input: Doctor, I have been feeling extremely weak and dizzy lately, and I bruise very easily. What could be the reason for this?
input_KG: Weakness, Dizziness, Bruise
output: Based on your symptoms, it is possible that you have Aplastic Anemia. To confirm the diagnosis, we will need to conduct a series of medical tests including a Hematologic test, Complete blood count (Cbc), Glucose measurement, Electrolytes panel, Complete physical skin exam performed (ML), Kidney function tests, and a Hemoglobin A1c measurement (Hemoglobin a1c test).

input: Hi doctor, I think I have overflow incontinence. I can't seem to control my urine flow and it's constantly leaking.
input_KG: Overflow incontinence, Urine leakage
output: Based on your symptoms, I will need to do a few tests to determine the cause of your incontinence. We will start with a urinalysis to evaluate your bladder health. We may also need to perform an ultrasound to measure your bladder capacity and check for any abnormalities. Additionally, I may need to perform a rectal examination to evaluate the tone of your anal sphincter. Finally, we may need to perform an endoscopy and biopsy of the urinary tract to rule out any structural abnormalities.

input: Doctor, I think I may have contracted rabies. I was bitten by a stray dog a few days ago and now I'm experiencing flu-like symptoms.
input_KG: Rabies, Bite from stray dog, Flu-like symptoms
output: The medical test you need to take is a CT scan of your abdomen. I need to check if the virus has spread to your internal organs. We can then proceed with treatment accordingly.

input: Hi doctor, I've been having pain on the outside of my elbow when I grip or lift things. It's been bothering me for a few weeks now.
input_KG: Elbow pain, Grip, Lifting<EOS>
output: Based on your symptoms, you may have lateral epicondylitis, commonly known as tennis elbow. We will prescribe physical therapy exercises, other therapeutic procedures, and the application of a splint to help manage the condition. In addition, an MRI may be necessary to rule out any other underlying conditions. We may also recommend other non-OR therapeutic procedures on the musculoskeletal system. Occupational therapy assessment may also be necessary to identify any work-related factors contributing to your symptoms. However, sigmoidoscopy or colonoscopy are not required for this condition.

input: Doctor, I think I might have syphilis.
input_KG: Syphilis
output: Okay, well in order to confirm a diagnosis, we'll need to run some tests. I recommend we start with a hematologic test, a complete physical skin exam, and a urinalysis. We'll also need to check your glucose level and perform wound care management. In addition, we'll need to run a chlamydia test and examine your breasts.

input: Hi doctor, I have been having some issues with my kidneys lately. My urine output has decreased and I feel generally unwell. I am a diabetic and I suspect it may be related to my kidney disease.
input_KG: Kidney disease, Diabetes, Urine output, Unwellness
output: I see. Given your symptoms and medical history, we will need to perform a series of tests to determine the root of the problem. We will need to order a complete blood count (CBC), a glucose measurement (by checking your glucose level), a urinalysis, a hemoglobin A1c measurement (hemoglobin A1c test), an electrolytes panel, and a lipid panel. These hematologic tests should help us determine the extent and severity of your diabetic kidney disease.

input: Doctor, I have been experiencing a lot of trouble with my nose lately. I have difficulty breathing, and sometimes I get these terrible headaches. I feel like there's something in my nose all the time, and it's making me very uncomfortable.
input_KG: Nose discomfort, Difficulty breathing, Headaches, Something in the nose
output: Based on your symptoms, we may need to perform some diagnostic procedures on your nose, mouth, and pharynx. We will also need to conduct an interview and evaluation to determine the cause of your discomfort. Additionally, we may need to perform an excision to remove anything that may be causing the obstruction. We will also do an Influenzavirus antibody assay to rule out any viral infections. Depending on the severity of the issue, we may need to consider plastic procedures on your nose or other OR therapeutic procedures on your nose, mouth, and pharynx.

input: Doctor, I've been feeling really sick lately. I think it might be because I stopped taking my medication.
input_KG: Doctor, FeelingSick, StoppedTakingMedication
output: Okay, it sounds like you might be going through drug withdrawal. We'll need to run some tests to determine the extent of the damage. We'll start with some hematologic tests, a complete blood count, and a urinalysis to check for any issues with your blood and urine. We'll also need to do some intravenous fluid replacement to help you feel better, and we'll need to measure your glucose levels to ensure they're normal. In addition, we'll need to run some kidney function tests and an electrolytes panel to check for any complications there.

input: Doctor, I think I may have dental caries. My tooth hurts whenever I eat something sweet or sour.
input_KG: Dental caries, Sweet or sour food, Tooth pain
output: Based on your symptoms, it is highly likely that you have dental caries. The required medical test for this would be a dental x-ray.

input: Doctor, I'm concerned about my high cholesterol readings from my latest blood test.
input_KG: Cholesterol, Blood test, High, Readings
output: For hypercholesterolemia, we will need to run a lipid panel test to get a comprehensive look at your cholesterol levels. We will also need to do a glucose measurement to check for diabetes or prediabetes, and perform a complete physical skin exam. Additionally, we will do an electrocardiogram to assess any potential heart problems, a hemoglobin A1c measurement to look at blood sugar levels over time, and an ultrasonography to check for any buildup or blockage in your blood vessels.

input: Doctor, I fell down the stairs and hurt my knee. It's swollen and painful. I think I may have fractured my patella.
input_KG: Doctor, FellDownTheStairs, HurtKnee, Swollen, Painful, FracturedPatella
output: Based on your symptoms, I would recommend a radiographic imaging procedure. We will need to do a plain x-ray to confirm if you have a fracture of the patella. We will also need to apply a splint to immobilize your knee and prescribe physical therapy exercises to aid in your recovery. If required, we may also do a scan ct to further examine the extent of the injury. In addition, we will also provide wound care management to prevent any infections. Do note that a head ct is not necessary for this injury.

input: Doctor, I have been feeling very weak lately and my urine output has decreased. I think there might be something wrong with my kidneys.
input_KG: Weakness, Urine output decrease, Kidney problem
output: I see, it's possible you might be suffering from kidney failure. To confirm this diagnosis, we will perform a series of medical tests, including Hematologic tests, Complete blood count, Glucose measurement, Electrolytes panel, Electrocardiogram, Plain x-ray, and Kidney function tests.

input: Doctor, I fell down the stairs and hurt my neck. I am in a lot of pain and it's hard for me to move my head.
input_KG: Fall, Neck injury, Pain, Head movement
output: Based on your symptoms, I recommend a radiographic imaging procedure, which includes a plain X-ray to detect any fractures in your neck. We'll also need to do a hematologic test, such as a complete blood count, to check for any blood abnormalities. In addition, we'll need to do a scan CT to get a clearer image of the affected area. We'll also need to run kidney function tests and an electrolytes panel to make sure these organs are functioning properly.

input: Hi, doctor. I've been experiencing a lot of muscle spasms lately. It's been very uncomfortable and painful, especially when I try to move around.
input_KG: Muscle spasms, Discomfort, Pain, Movement
output: I'm sorry to hear that. Based on your symptoms, I would recommend a plain x-ray to take a closer look at your muscles and bones. We'll also need to schedule you for some physical therapy exercises to help strengthen your muscles and prevent further spasms. Additionally, we may need to do some other diagnostic procedures to get a better understanding of what's causing the spasms.

input: Doctor, I have been diagnosed with Hemophilia. Can you please tell me what tests I need to go through to get a better understanding of my condition?
input_KG: Hemophilia, Tests, Better understanding, Condition
output: To monitor your Hemophilia, you will need to have regular Hematologic tests and Complete Blood Counts (CBC) done. Additionally, Ultrasonography can be helpful in detecting any potential internal bleeding. I would also recommend you get a referral to a home health care service for ongoing care. Furthermore, since Hemophilia is a genetic disease, you might need a Fetal monitoring test if you want to plan for kids in the future. To ensure overall health, we will also need to perform an HIV screen (HIV test). Lastly, other therapeutic procedures may be required depending on your condition.

input: Hi doctor, I've been experiencing extreme thirst, frequent urination, and fatigue. I also have a fruity breath odor. I'm worried because I had a relative who had diabetes.
input_KG: Thirst, Urine production, Fatigue, Fruity breath odor, Diabetes risk
output: Based on your symptoms, you may be experiencing hyperosmotic hyperketotic state. To diagnose this condition, we need to perform a series of medical tests including Hematologic tests, Glucose measurement, Complete blood count, Intravenous fluid replacement, Cardiac enzymes measurement, Electrocardiogram, and Kidney function tests.

input: Doctor, I've been experiencing intense pain on one side of my throat, difficulty swallowing and a high fever.
input_KG: Throat pain, One side, Difficulty swallowing, High fever
output: Based on your symptoms, it sounds like you might have a peritonsillar abscess. In order to confirm the diagnosis and determine the severity, we'll need to run some tests. You'll need a blood test, a CBC, and a kidney function test to assess how well your organs are functioning. We'll also need to check your electrolyte and glucose levels. Additionally, we may need to administer IV fluids to keep you hydrated during your treatment. Lastly, a CT scan will be required to determine the extent of the abscess.

input: Hi doctor, I have been experiencing symptoms such as nausea, vomiting, bloating and abdominal pain after I eat. I think I might have Gastroparesis.
input_KG: nausea, vomiting, bloating, abdominal pain, gastroparesis
output: Alright, we can start with some hematologic tests such as a complete blood count (CBC) to check for any abnormalities in your blood. We'll also want to measure your glucose level as well as do an electrolyte panel and kidney function test. We'll also need to give you some intravenous fluid replacement and do a urinalysis to make sure everything is functioning properly.

input: Doctor, I have been feeling very tired lately and have been experiencing shortness of breath. I also have pain in my chest and joints.
input_KG: Tiredness, Shortness of breath, Chest pain, Joint pain
output: Based on your symptoms, I would like to perform a CT scan of your abdomen as well as a bone marrow transplant (BMT).

input: Doctor, I have been feeling very fatigued lately and my skin looks pale. I also have bruises all over my body which seem to take forever to heal.
input_KG: Fatigue, Pale skin, Bruises, Slow healing
output: Based on your symptoms, I would like to order some blood tests. We will be testing your blood for a condition called thrombocytopenia. The tests include hematologic tests, complete blood count (CBC), glucose measurement, electrolytes panel, kidney function tests, hemoglobin A1c measurement, and a complete physical skin exam performed.

input: Doctor, I think I have head and neck cancer. I have noticed some lumps on my neck and I have difficulty swallowing.
input_KG: Head and neck cancer, Lumps, Neck, Swallowing difficulty
output: I'm sorry to hear that. In order to confirm the diagnosis, we will need to perform a biopsy. It involves taking a small sample of the lump and examining it under a microscope. Additionally, we will need to perform a Complete blood count (Cbc) to check for any abnormalities in your blood. We will also need to do a Magnetic resonance imaging (Mri) and an X-ray computed tomography (Scan ct) to get a better look at the extent of the cancer. We may also require to perform Therapeutic radiology for cancer treatment (Irradiation) to kill cancer cells in the affected areas. We will also have to monitor wound care management and perform Occupational therapy assessment (Speech therapy) to ensure the best possible outcome.

input: Doctor, I've been experiencing muscle spasms and tingling sensations in my fingers and toes. I was diagnosed with pseudohypoparathyroidism a few years ago and I think it's getting worse.
input_KG: Pseudohypoparathyroidism, Muscle spasms, Tingling sensations, Fingers, Toes
output: In order to assess your condition, we will need to perform a few medical tests. We will start with a radiographic imaging procedure and a plain x-ray to get a better look at the affected areas. We will also need to do a complete physical skin exam to check for any related symptoms. Additionally, an electrolytes panel and liver function test will be required to assess your overall health. Depending on the results of these tests, we may also need to do a magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) to get a more detailed look at your condition. Lastly, debridement of any wounds, infections or burns should also be considered.

input: Doctor, I have been experiencing swelling in my neck and difficulty in swallowing. I am worried it could be goiter.
input_KG: Swelling in the neck, Difficulty swallowing, Goiter
output: Based on your symptoms, we need to conduct a few tests to confirm if it is goiter. We need to perform a Hematology test, an ultrasound, a lipid panel, a complete physical skin exam, and a biopsy. Once we have the results of the tests, we can confirm the diagnosis. In some cases, we may also recommend an excision to remove the goiter depending on the severity of the condition. Additionally, we'll need to perform a Hemoglobin A1c measurement test to ensure you don't have diabetes which can exacerbate this condition.

input: Doctor, I have been experiencing sudden and strong urges to urinate, which often result in involuntary leakage. I'm embarrassed to bring it up, but I can't ignore it anymore.
input_KG: Urgency to urinate, Involuntary leakage, Embarrassment
output: Thank you for sharing that with me. We'll need to run some medical tests to determine the cause of your incontinence. The first test we'll need to do is a urinalysis to check for any urinary tract infections or other abnormalities in your urine. We'll also need to do a pelvic exam to check for any physical abnormalities that could be contributing to your condition. Additionally, we'll need to do a prostate-specific antigen measurement test and a rectal examination to check for any issues with your prostate. An ultrasound may also be needed to get a better look at your bladder and other organs in your pelvis. Finally, we'll need to do a lipid panel to evaluate your cholesterol levels, which can sometimes impact bladder function.

input: Doctor, I have a deep cut on my arm that won't stop bleeding. What's wrong with me?
input_KG: Deep cut, Arm, Bleeding, Possible injury
output: It sounds like you have an open wound. The first thing we need to do is suturing of the wound to stop the bleeding. After that, we need to do a plain x-ray to check if there are any foreign objects in the wound. We also need to manage the wound care and potentially apply a splint. Lastly, we may need to do a toxicology screen and blood alcohol test. In severe cases, we might have to do a CAT scan of your head to rule out any nerve damage.

input: Hi Doctor, I've been having some difficulty with my muscles lately. I've been feeling a lot weaker and it's been affecting my ability to move around. I'm also experiencing muscle spasms and cramps more frequently.
input_KG: Muscle weakness, Movement difficulties, Increased muscle spasms and cramps
output: Based on your symptoms, it sounds like you may have muscular dystrophy. To confirm this diagnosis, we will need to perform several medical tests. The first test we will perform is a complete physical skin exam to evaluate the condition of your muscle tissue. We will also need to do an electrocardiogram to check the functioning of your heart. In addition, we will need to conduct other diagnostic procedures such as interviews and evaluations to understand the extent of the disease. Finally, an occupational therapy assessment and referral to home health care service may be necessary to help you manage your symptoms. We may also recommend physical therapy exercises and other therapeutic procedures to help you regain some of your mobility.

input: Doctor, my eye has been hurting a lot lately. It feels like there's something in there.
input_KG: Eye pain, Something in the eye
output: It sounds like you may have a corneal abrasion. We'll need to take a closer look and do a few tests. First, we'll need to do a nonoperative removal of any foreign body in your eye, followed by wound care management. After that, we'll need to do an ophthalmic examination and evaluation to take a closer look at your eye.

input: Doctor, I have been feeling really tired and weak lately, even after getting a lot of rest. I did some research and I think I might have Anemia of chronic disease, what tests should I get done to confirm it?
input_KG: Chronic disease, Anemia, Rest, Tests
output: Based on what you are saying, it is possible for you to have anemia of chronic disease. To confirm this, I would recommend doing a few medical tests such as a complete blood count (CBC), a glucose measurement to check your blood sugar levels, an electrolyte panel, and an electrocardiogram. Also, we will need to do a Hemoglobin A1c measurement test along with a complete physical skin exam to rule out any other possibilities.

input: Doctor, I have been feeling down and depressed for a long time. I wake up every morning feeling sad and anxious. I feel like I am always in a low mood and can't seem to shake it off.
input_KG: Depression, Low mood, Sadness, Anxiety
output: I understand, it sounds like you may be experiencing dysthymic disorder. I recommend that you undergo a depression screen to confirm the diagnosis. Additionally, you should undergo psychological and psychiatric evaluation to determine the best course of treatment, which may include psychotherapy and mental health counseling. As for the other tests you mentioned, a lipid panel and toxicology screen would not be necessary for this particular condition. Finally, varicose vein stripping is not related to this issue and is not required.

input: Doctor, I think I might have Scarlet fever. I have a rash all over my body and my throat is sore.
input_KG: Rash, Throat soreness, Scarlet fever
output: Based on your symptoms, I would like to perform a complete physical skin exam to confirm the diagnosis. Additionally, I would like to conduct an Influenzavirus antibody assay to rule out concurrent influenza infection.

input: Doctor, I have been experiencing shortness of breath, fatigue and swelling in my legs lately. My previous medical history also indicates that I have high blood pressure. Could it be related to my heart?
input_KG: shortness of breath, fatigue, swelling, high blood pressure, heart
output: Yes, it is possible that you are suffering from hypertensive heart disease. In order to confirm the diagnosis and evaluate the extent of the disease, I would recommend you to undergo a series of medical tests such as hematologic tests (blood test), complete blood count (CBC), electrocardiogram, glucose measurement (glucose level), lipid panel, ultrasonography (ultrasound), and a complete physical skin exam performed (ML). These tests will help me to understand the severity of your condition and provide you with an appropriate treatment plan.

input: Hi Doctor, I have been struggling with drug abuse of barbiturates lately. I feel like it's taking a toll on my mental and physical health.
input_KG: Drug abuse, Barbiturates, Mental health, Physical health
output: I'm sorry to hear that. We need to start with mental health counseling and psychotherapy. Also, we need to perform a series of tests to analyze the levels of drugs and alcohol in your system. This includes Urinalysis, Blood Alcohol levels, and a Toxicology Screen. We also need to perform a Psychological and Psychiatric evaluation and Therapy to develop a treatment plan that is tailored to your individual needs. Lastly, we need to perform a Depression Screen to check if you are suffering from Depression.

input: Hi doctor, I have been experiencing irregular periods and excessive hair growth on my face and body. I also experience acne on my skin from time to time.
input_KG: Irregular periods, Excessive hair growth, Face and body, Acne, Skin
output: It sounds like you may be suffering from Polycystic Ovarian Syndrome or PCOS. To confirm the diagnosis, we will need to conduct a series of medical tests including hematologic tests, a pelvic exam, and ultrasonography. We will also need to examine your breasts, perform a lipid panel test, and check if you are pregnant with a standard pregnancy test. Finally, we will need to conduct a Hemoglobin A1c measurement to check for insulin resistance.

input: Doctor, I have been experiencing severe headaches and confusion lately. I am also having difficulty speaking and understanding things. What could be wrong with me?
input_KG: Headaches, Confusion, Speech difficulties, Understanding issues
output: Based on your symptoms, it is possible that you are suffering from encephalitis. In order to confirm this, we will need to conduct a few medical tests. We will need to do radiographic imaging and a magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of your brain. We may also need to have you do some physical therapy exercises and other diagnostic procedures such as an interview, evaluation, and consultation with a specialist. Additionally, we may need to carry out an occupational therapy assessment, speech therapy, liver function tests, and a diagnostic spinal tap to be sure and give you the appropriate treatment.

input: Hi doctor, I think I have a cyst on my eyelid. It's been bothering me for a while now and it's starting to affect my vision.
input_KG: cyst, eyelid, vision
output: Based on your symptoms, the required medical test for your condition would be excision (removal) and biopsy of the cyst. However, if the cyst has caused damage to your vision, we may need to do lens and cataract procedures, other therapeutic procedures on your eyelids, conjunctiva, or cornea, or even a corneal transplant. We may also need to do ophthalmologic and otologic diagnosis and treatment. Lastly, procedures on the spleen may be necessary only in rare cases.

input: Doctor, I have been experiencing redness, swelling and pain in my penis head for the past few days. I think I might have Balanitis.
output: It is advisable to undergo a Complete physical skin exam performed, Urinalysis, a Rectal examination, and Prostate specific antigen measurement. Also, we may need to perform Excision and Other diagnostic procedures like an interview, evaluation and consultation. As part of the treatment plan, we may recommend you to get Prophylactic vaccinations and inoculations.

input: Doctor, I feel like there is something stuck in my throat and I can't seem to swallow properly.
input_KG: something stuck, throat, swallow
output: Based on your symptoms, you may have a foreign body in your throat. We will need to do a radiographic imaging procedure, such as a plain x-ray, to locate the object.Patient Is there a possibility of removing it non-operatively?

input: Hi doctor, I have been struggling with drug abuse, especially cocaine. I want to get help.
input_KG: something stuck, throat, swallow
output: I'm glad to hear that. In order to assess and treat your condition, I recommend a series of medical tests. These include mental health counseling and psychotherapy to address the underlying psychological issues that may contribute to your addiction. We will also need to conduct a urinalysis, electrocardiogram, toxicology screen, blood alcohol test, and liver function test to evaluate your overall health and the extent of the damage caused by your drug use.

input: Hi Doctor, I have been experiencing vision problems lately, and my eye has been hurting with movements. Could you please help me?
input_KG: Drug abuse, Cocaine, Seeking help
output: Based on what you've shared with me, it is possible that you might have optic neuritis. I would recommend a series of tests to confirm the diagnosis. We need to conduct a radiographic imaging procedure, a magnetic resonance imaging (MRI), and an ophthalmic examination and evaluation (eye exam). Additionally, a diagnostic spinal tap (spinal tap), diagnostic ultrasound of the heart (echocardiogram), and other therapeutic procedures on the eyelids, conjunctiva or cornea may also be required. Patient Thank you for your help, Doctor. I will get the tests done as soon as possible.

input: Doctor, I've been feeling some palpitations lately and my heart seems to be racing at times.
input_KG: Vision problems, Eye pain, Movements
output: Based on what you're describing, I suspect that you may have premature atrial contractions (PACs). Patient What kind of tests will I need to confirm this?

input: Doctor, I am experiencing weakness on one side of my body and difficulty in speaking. I was recently diagnosed with Hemiplegia. What medical tests do I need to undergo?
input_KG: Palpitations, Heart racing
output: You will need to undergo a Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) to assess the extent of brain damage caused by Hemiplegia. You may also require Radiographic imaging procedure and X-ray computed tomography (CT) scan to check for any underlying structural abnormalities. In addition, regular Physical therapy exercises will be essential for rehabilitation. Further evaluation will include a Glucose measurement (Glucose level) to rule out diabetes and an Electrolytes panel to check for any electrolyte imbalances. Lastly, an Electrocardiogram will also be required to monitor your heart function.

input: Doctor, my second toe is constantly bent downwards and it's causing me pain while walking. I think I might have hammer toe.
input_KG: second toe, bent, pain, walking, hammer toe
output: Based on your symptoms, I would recommend a physical examination of your foot to confirm the diagnosis. In addition, we will need to do a plain x-ray to evaluate the extent of the deformity. Wound care management may be necessary if the toe is rubbing against your shoe and causing skin irritation. If the condition is severe, removal of the affected bone may be required through excision or bunionectomy. Electrocardiogram is not a test for this condition. Application of a splint may also be helpful to straighten out the toe.

input: Doctor, I fell off my bike and got an open wound on my cheek. What do I need to do?
input_KG: Hammer toe, Pain while walking
output: We need to suture your wound to close it up. Additionally, we need to do a radiographic imaging procedure to see if there is any damage to your bones or tissues. This will include a plain x-ray and a CT scan of your head. We also need to do wound care management to prevent infection. Lastly, we need to culture the wound to see if there is any bacterial infection.

input: Doctor, I've been having swelling and pain in my knee joint for the past few days. It's difficult for me to bend or straighten my leg.
input_KG: Bike accident, Open wound, Cheek, First aid
output: Based on your symptoms, it's possible that you have joint effusion. To confirm this, we need to perform a radiographic imaging procedure. This may involve a plain X-ray or an MRI, depending on the severity of your condition. We may also recommend physical therapy exercises or the application of a splint to relieve your symptoms. Additionally, we may need to examine your foot and recommend other non-OR therapeutic procedures on your musculoskeletal system.

input: Hi Doctor, I have an open wound on my knee that hurts when I move it.
input_KG: Knee swelling, Pain, Knee joint, Difficulty bending or straightening leg
output: Okay, for an open wound of the knee, we need to perform wound care management and complete a physical skin exam. We may have to suture the wound if it's deep enough, and we may need to apply a splint to keep the knee stable. In severe cases, we may have to excise the wound. If needed, we'll refer you to a home health care service. We'll also examine your foot to ensure there is no further injury.

input: Doctor, I have been having severe headaches, blurred vision, and difficulty remembering things. I went to a neurologist and was diagnosed with meningioma. What tests do I need to undergo?
input_KG: Knee injury, Open wound, Movement
output: The required medical tests for meningioma are radiographic imaging procedure, magnetic resonance imaging (MRI), X-ray computed tomography (Scan CT), CAT scan of head (Head CT). Additionally, you might need a depression screening and physical therapy exercises. In some cases, an incision and excision of CNS may also be required.

input: Doctor, I have been experiencing severe headaches and blurred vision. My family history suggests that my grandfather had brain cancer. What do you think is causing my symptoms?
input_KG: Headaches, Blurred vision, Memory issues, Meningioma, Neurologist, Tests
output: Based on your symptoms and family history, I suspect you may have brain cancer. To confirm the diagnosis, we will need to run a series of tests. These include a hematologic test to analyze your blood, a complete blood count to check for abnormalities, radiographic imaging procedures such as MRI and CT scans, a glucose measurement to evaluate your blood sugar levels, and an electrolytes panel to assess your body's balance of minerals and vitamins.

input: Doctor, I think I might have placental abruption. I've been experiencing constant abdominal pain and vaginal bleeding.
input_KG: Headaches, Blurred vision, Family history of brain cancer
output: I'm sorry to hear that. In order to diagnose placental abruption, we will require several tests. The first test we will conduct is a radiographic imaging procedure. This will allow us to see a clear image of the inside of your body. We will also conduct hematologic tests such as a blood test to check your blood clotting levels. Ultrasonography (Ultrasound) will provide a clear picture of your placenta and the structure of your uterus. We'll do a pelvic exam to check the dilation of your cervix, and urinalysis to rule out any other infections. A complete blood count will be performed to check your red blood cells, white blood cells, and platelet count. We will also examine your breasts to check for any signs of milk production.

input: Doctor, I have been experiencing itchy and watery eyes, sneezing, and a runny nose. I think I might have seasonal allergies.
input_KG: Placental abruption, Abdominal pain, Vaginal bleeding
output: Based on your symptoms, I recommend we start with an ophthalmic examination and evaluation to assess your eye health. Additionally, a complete physical skin exam will be performed to check for any reactions there as well. We may also need to conduct other diagnostic procedures, such as an interview, evaluation, or consultation. Along with that, we will need to run a lipid panel and potentially conduct other diagnostic procedures on your skin to rule out any other underlying conditions. Does that all sound good to you?

input: Doctor, I have been experiencing coughing, chest pain and shortness of breath. The other day, I coughed up blood as well. I am concerned I might have lung cancer.
input_KG: coughing, chest pain, shortness of breath, blood, lung cancer
output: I understand your concerns. In order to diagnose or rule out lung cancer, we will need to conduct a series of medical tests. The required medical tests include a CBC or Complete Blood Count, Hematologic Tests, Radiographic Imaging Procedure, Glucose Measurement, Scan CT, Electrolytes panel and a complete physical skin exam performed. These medical tests will help us to understand the nature and extent of your illness.

input: Doctor, I have been experiencing some discomfort in my kidneys lately. I think I might have a primary kidney disease.
input_KG: Coughing, Chest pain, Shortness of breath, Coughed up blood, Lung cancer
output: I understand your concern. Based on your symptoms, I think we should run some tests. We will need to perform a Hematologic test, a Complete Blood Count (CBC), a Urinalysis, Glucose measurement (Glucose level), an Electrolytes panel, and a Lipid panel. We also need to perform a Complete Physical Skin Exam.

input: Doctor, I have been experiencing abnormal vaginal bleeding and cramps. I am concerned it might be something serious.
input_KG: abnormal vaginal bleeding, cramps, something serious
output: Based on your symptoms, we need to perform a pelvic exam as well as some hematology blood tests including a complete blood count to check your blood cells. We also need to examine your breasts and perform a complete physical skin exam. Additionally, we need to perform a rectal examination and a Scan CT to check for any signs of uterine cancer.

input: Doctor, I've been experiencing dryness in my eyes lately.
input_KG: Dryness, Eyes
output: Based on your symptoms, I recommend an ophthalmic examination and evaluation. We may also need to perform other therapeutic procedures on your eyelids, conjunctiva, and cornea. In addition, we may need to perform diagnostic procedures on your eyes and other intraocular therapeutic procedures. It's important to get a complete ophthalmologic and otologic diagnosis and treatment, which may include other extraocular muscle and orbit therapeutic procedures or lens and cataract procedures.

input: I've been feeling really sick lately with a fever, muscle aches, and vomiting. I went to the lake last week and I'm worried I might have leptospirosis.
input_KG: fever, muscle aches, vomiting, leptospirosis
output: Based on your symptoms and recent activities, it's important we test for leptospirosis. We'll need to do a CT scan of your abdomen to check for any damage to your internal organs. Additionally, we'll need to do procedures on your spleen. This will help us determine if you need a bone marrow transplant. It's important we act fast. We'll also need to control your epistaxis to make sure you don't have any further bleeding. Finally, we'll need to do a coronory thrombolysis to ensure your heart health remains stable. Let's get started right away.

input: Doctor, I have been diagnosed with VACTERL syndrome. What medical tests do I need to undergo?
input_KG: Fever, Muscle aches, Vomiting, Leptospirosis, Lake visit
output: For VACTERL syndrome, you will require a rectal examination, physical therapy exercises, magnetic resonance imaging, ultrasonography, and other diagnostic procedures such as interviews, evaluations, and consultations. In severe cases, procedures on the spleen like a spleen operation might also be recommended. Additionally, if you have any corneal abnormalities, a corneal transplant may also be needed.

input: Hi doctor, I have been experiencing some symptoms related to my rectum like frequent constipation, rectal bleeding, and abdominal cramps. What could be the issue and what medical tests do I need to take?
input_KG: VACTERL syndrome, Medical tests
output: Based on your symptoms, I would recommend a thorough rectal examination, a sigmoidoscopy or colonoscopy to check for any abnormalities in your rectum or colon, and also some hematologic tests such as a complete blood count, glucose measurement, electrolytes panel, and kidney function tests to assess the overall health of your body.

input: Doctor, I have been experiencing difficulty in urinating for the past week. Sometimes, it takes me a long time to start urinating, and I feel like I have not completely emptied my bladder. I am also experiencing bladder leakage. Do you have an idea of what could be wrong with me?
input_KG: Rectal issues, Constipation, Rectal bleeding, Abdominal cramps, Medical tests
output: Based on your symptoms, you might be suffering from atonic bladder. We need to perform several diagnostic tests to confirm the diagnosis. You will need to undergo a urinalysis to check for any infections. We will also need to perform a prostate-specific antigen measurement test and rectal examination to see if there is any problem with your prostate. Additionally, we will need to conduct an ultrasonography to check your bladder and urethra's condition. If these do not provide any conclusive answers, we may need to do a CT scan or other diagnostic procedures. Once we have the diagnosis confirmed, we will determine the best non-surgical treatment options for your urinary tract.

input: Doctor, I have been experiencing dizziness and a feeling of everything spinning around me. It's been happening for a few days now and I'm a bit worried.
input_KG: Urination difficulties, Long time to start urinating, Incomplete bladder emptying, Bladder leakage
output: It sounds like you may have Benign paroxysmal positional vertical (BPPV). To confirm this, we will need to run a few medical tests. We will need to do a Radiographic imaging procedure and X-ray computed tomography (Scan ct) to examine your inner ear. We will also need to do Hematologic tests (Blood test), a Complete blood count (Cbc), Glucose measurement (Glucose level), and Kidney function tests (Kidney function test) to check for any underlying conditions that may be causing your symptoms. If we do find any additional issues, Intravenous fluid replacement may also be necessary.

input: Doctor, I have been experiencing involuntary twitching of my eyelids, which is making it difficult for me to undertake daily activities. Do you know what is wrong with me?
input_KG: Dizziness, Spinning sensation, Worried
output: It sounds like you have blepharospasm. To determine the exact cause and severity of your condition, we need to perform injections and aspirations of muscles, tendons, bursa, joints and soft tissue. Other therapeutic procedures, as well as other diagnostic procedures such as interviews, evaluations and consultations may also be required. In addition, we'll need to conduct an ophthalmic examination and evaluation to rule out any other underlying eye conditions. However, corneal transplants, spleen operations, and removal of ectopic pregnancy are not relevant in your case.

input: Doctor, I've been having some breathing problems and my lymph nodes have been swollen. I also feel very fatigued most of the time.
input_KG: Eyelids twitching, Daily activities, Involuntary, Difficulty<EOS>
output: Based on your symptoms, we need to run some tests to determine if you have sarcoidosis. We'll start with a complete blood count (CBC) to check your red and white blood cells, as well as a hematology test. We'll also need to do a radiographic imaging procedure, such as an x-ray or MRI, to get a closer look at your lungs and lymph nodes. In addition, we will perform a complete physical skin exam, and an electrocardiogram to check your heart function.

input: Doctor, I have been feeling very weak and have lost a lot of weight recently. I went to the hospital and was diagnosed with metastatic cancer. What tests do I need to take now?
input_KG: Breathing problems, Swollen lymph nodes, Fatigue
output: I am sorry to hear that. Since you have metastatic cancer, we will need to run a series of tests to fully diagnose and treat the disease. We will need to start with hematologic tests, a complete blood count, and a radiographic imaging procedure. We will also need to measure your glucose level, perform a scan ct, examine your electrolytes panel, and a complete physical skin exam needs to be performed.

input: Doctor, I have been experiencing some discomfort and stiffness in my fingers, especially when trying to bend them. It seems like my finger sometimes locks in a bent position too.
input_KG: Weakness, Weight loss, Metastatic cancer, Tests
output: It sounds like you may have trigger finger. In order to properly manage this condition, we will need to perform a few medical tests. These will include wound care management, other therapeutic procedures, and physical therapy exercises to help increase flexibility and range of motion in your fingers. We may also need to apply a splint to support the affected finger, and an occupational therapy assessment may be necessary to determine if you need speech therapy. In some cases, injections and aspirations of muscles, tendons, bursa, joints, and soft tissue may be required, as well as decompression peripheral nerve treatment.

input: Doctor, I have a painful bump on my eyelid, and it hurts when I blink. I think it might be a stye.
input_KG: Finger pain, Stiffness, Locking position
output: Okay, based on your symptoms, we will need to perform an ophthalmic examination and evaluation, which includes an eye exam. After that, we may need to do a culture wound to determine if there is an infection present. Depending on the severity of the stye, we may also need to consider physical therapy exercises, manipulation, or other procedures. If the stye has not improved, we may need to do an incision and drainage (I&D) or a nonoperative removal of foreign body.

input: Doctor, I have been feeling extremely fatigued and weak lately, and I have noticed that my skin has been turning a bronze color. I am also experiencing joint pain and abdominal pain.
input_KG: fatigued, weak, bronze color, joint pain, abdominal pain
output: Based on your symptoms, I would like to order a few medical tests to give us a better understanding of what may be causing these issues. We will need to start by performing hematologic tests and a complete blood count (CBC). In addition, we will need to complete a physical skin exam to assess the bronze color you mentioned. We will also perform a lipid panel, and a hemoglobin A1c measurement (Hemoglobin A1c test). Depending on the results of these tests, we may recommend other therapeutic procedures. However, I do not think that a prostate specific antigen measurement test is necessary for your current set of symptoms.

input: Doctor, I have been experiencing pain and swelling in my knee for a while now. After consulting with a friend who is a medical professional, they suggested that I may have Osteochondroma. What should I do?
input_KG: Fatigue, Weakness, Skin discoloration, Bronze color, Joint pain, Abdominal pain
output: Alright. Based on your symptoms, I would suggest we conduct a radiographic imaging procedure to confirm the diagnosis. This can be done through a plain x-ray (X-ray). Additionally, we may need to perform a biopsy or an excision (removal) to remove the affected bone growth. Depending on the severity of the condition, we may also need to perform a complete physical skin exam and wound care management. Other diagnostic procedures, like an interview, evaluation, or consultation may also be necessary.

input: Doctor, I've been experiencing symptoms like rapid weight gain, mood swings, and excessive hair growth. I also have high blood pressure and a round face. Can you tell me what could be causing all of these symptoms?
input_KG: Knee pain, Swelling, Osteochondroma, Medical advice
output: Based on your symptoms, it's possible that you might be suffering from Cushing syndrome. To confirm the diagnosis, we need to run some medical tests such as a blood test, an electrolytes panel, a Glucose level measurement, an Eye exam, a Depression screening, an MRI, and a complete physical skin exam performed by a nurse practitioner or a physician assistant.

input: Doctor, I've been experiencing fever, headaches, and stomach pains for the past few days. I'm worried that I may have typhoid fever. What medical tests should I take?
input_KG: Rapid weight gain, Mood swings, Excessive hair growth, High blood pressure, Round face
output: Based on your symptoms, we need to conduct several medical tests to determine if you have typhoid fever. We need to perform an influenzavirus antibody assay, blood culture, CBC, and hematologic tests. However, a corneal transplant, TURP, and coronary thrombolysis are not necessary for typhoid fever diagnosis.

input: Doctor, I have been experiencing floaters and flashes of light in my vision. What could be wrong?
input_KG: Fever, Headaches, Stomach pain, Typhoid fever, Medical tests
output: Based on your symptoms, you may be experiencing vitreous degeneration. We will need to perform an ophthalmic examination and evaluation (eye exam), as well as other diagnostic procedures on your eyes to confirm the diagnosis. Treatment may include repair of any retinal tears or detachments, along with other intraocular therapeutic procedures. We may also need to perform lens and cataract procedures, or other therapeutic procedures on your eyelids, conjunctiva, or cornea if necessary.

input: Doctor, I have a skin condition where the affected area is becoming thinner and losing its elasticity. I am concerned about it, what test will I need for this?
input_KG: Floaters, Flashes of light, Vision problems
output: Based on your symptoms, I would recommend a complete physical skin exam performed by a dermatologist. They may also suggest an excision or removal of the affected area, or even a biopsy to determine the cause of your atrophic skin condition. Other tests that may be required to manage your condition include wound care management, injections and aspirations of muscles, tendons, bursa, joints and soft tissue, and other diagnostic procedures on skin and subcutaneous tissue.

input: Doctor, I have been feeling really tired lately and have been experiencing difficulty breathing. I also have a persistent cough and chest pain.
input_KG: Skin condition, Elasticity loss, Test
output: Based on your symptoms, I suspect you may have aspergillosis. In order to confirm this, we will need to conduct several medical tests including a radiographic imaging procedure, electrocardiogram, plain x-ray, complete blood count, hematologic tests, magnetic resonance imaging, and cardiac monitoring. These tests will help us get a better understanding of your condition and develop the most effective treatment plan.

input: Hi doctor, I have been experiencing heavy bleeding after giving birth to my child. It has been two days already, and I am worried.
input_KG: Fatigue, Difficulty breathing, Persistent cough, Chest pain
output: I see. Based on what you've told me, you may have uterine atony. In order to diagnose this condition, I would advise you to have some medical tests. You need to take a hematologic test, complete blood count (CBC), a standard pregnancy test, pelvis exam, urinalysis, radiographic imaging procedure, and an ultrasonography (ultrasound).

input: Doctor, I think I have trichinosis.
input_KG: Heavy bleeding, Childbirth, Concern
output: In that case, we need to run a few medical tests to confirm the diagnosis. We'll need a chlamydia test, urinalysis, and a CT scan of your abdomen.

input: Doctor, I have a persistent cough and it's getting worse. It's doesn't seem like a regular cold or flu. I've been doing some research and it appears to be whooping cough.
input_KG: Trichinosis
output: To confirm if you have whooping cough, we will need to conduct a radiographic imaging procedure and a plain X-ray to examine your lungs. We will also need to conduct a nebulizer therapy and other diagnostic procedures, such as an interview, evaluation, and consultation to determine the appropriate treatment plan. In some severe cases, a referral to a home health care service may be necessary. However, a corneal transplant and procedures on the spleen are not related to whooping cough.

input: I have an open wound on my lip that won't stop bleeding. What tests do I need to take?
input_KG: Whooping cough, Persistent cough, Research
output: Based on your symptoms, I recommend suturing of the wound and wound care management. We may also need to perform a culture of the wound to identify any possible infections. Additionally, we may consider a Head CT scan to check for any underlying injuries. It's essential that we also run a blood alcohol test to rule out any substance abuse that may have contributed to the injury. Lastly, we may need to consider other non-OR therapeutic procedures on your nose, mouth, and pharynx, depending on the severity of the wound.

input: Doctor, I have been experiencing fever, neck pain, fatigue and weight loss. I went to another doctor earlier who prescribed antibiotics to me, but it hasn't helped at all. Can you help me?
input_KG: Open wound, Lip, Bleeding, Tests
output: Based on your symptoms, I suspect that you may have subacute thyroiditis. In order to confirm this diagnosis, we'll need to do a few medical tests. Your first step will be to undergo hematologic tests, such as a blood test. We'll also need to perform a radiographic imaging procedure, a urinalysis, a pelvis exam, ultrasonography and a glucose measurement. Finally, we'll also need to examine your breast to confirm there are no abnormalities.

input: Doctor, I have recently noticed a small spot on the inside of my cheek that doesn't seem to go away. It's been there for a few weeks now and sometimes it hurts when I eat.
input_KG: Fever, Neck pain, Fatigue, Weight loss, Antibiotics
output: Based on what you've described, it's possible that you have an oral mucosal lesion. In order to diagnose this, we will need to perform a biopsy. This involves taking a small sample of tissue from the affected area and sending it to a lab for analysis. Depending on the results of the biopsy, we may need to perform additional diagnostic procedures on your nose, mouth, and pharynx, or even remove the lesion entirely through excision or other therapeutic procedures. We may also need to perform a tracheoscopy and laryngoscopy with biopsy or other therapeutic ear procedures if we suspect the lesion to be spreading.

input: Hi Doctor, I have an open wound on my arm due to a recent injury. The pain is quite severe and I am worried about proper treatment for it.
input_KG: Cheek spot, Pain when eating
output: Hello, I am sorry to hear that. Based on your symptoms, I suggest we perform a complete physical skin exam along with wound care management. We will also need to suture the wound and examine your foot. Additionally, we need to do a CAT scan of your head to check for any possible head injury. We will also need to apply a splint to immobilize the injured limb. It's important we also check your blood alcohol level to ensure proper wound care management.

input: Doctor, I've been having severe headaches and I recently had a blackout. The doctors at the emergency room told me that I have an intracerebral hemorrhage. What tests do I need to take?
input_KG: Open wound, Arm injury, Pain, Treatment
output: Alright. We need to perform some tests to assess your condition properly. First, we need to do a radiographic imaging procedure to locate and assess the damage caused by the hemorrhage. We also need to do a CT scan to have a more detailed image of the hemorrhage. Additionally, we need to take a blood test to check if there is anemia or if you have abnormal blood clotting. A complete blood count is necessary to look into your red blood cells, white blood cells, and platelets. An electrocardiogram will also be conducted to evaluate your heart's health, as this may have caused the hemorrhage in the first place. Finally, we need to monitor your fluid intake. We may have to administer intravenous fluid replacement to keep your fluid and electrolyte balance stable.

input: Doctor, I have been experiencing memory loss and confusion lately. I am afraid that I may have Alzheimer's disease.
input_KG: Headaches, Blackout, Intracerebral hemorrhage, Tests
output: We will need to conduct a few tests to make a diagnosis. First, we will need you to undergo an Electrocardiogram (ECG) to check your heart function. We will also need to do an X-ray computed tomography (CT) scan of your brain to check for any abnormalities. After that, we will refer you to a mental health counselor for a consultation and evaluation. We may also recommend psychotherapy to help with your memory loss. Lastly, a Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) and CAT scan of your head (Head CT) may also be necessary as other diagnostic procedures.

input: Doctor, I have been experiencing severe pain and discomfort during sexual intercourse. It feels like my vaginal muscles are contracting and it's becoming difficult to have sex.
input_KG: severe pain, discomfort, sexual intercourse, vaginal muscles, contracting
output: Based on your symptoms, I would recommend a pelvis exam to check for any abnormalities in your reproductive organs. I would also suggest an examination of your breast to rule out any possibilities of breast cancer. Additionally, a urinalysis will help us test for any underlying infection. An ultrasonography (ultrasound) will also help us identify any structural abnormalities in your pelvic region. A rectal examination can further assist us in identifying any issues in your rectum or surrounding muscles that may be contributing to your discomfort. Lastly, a complete physical skin exam will be performed to rule out any other skin diseases. Based on your age and medical history, I may also suggest a mammography (mammogram) as a precautionary measure.

input: Doctor, I have been experiencing irregular menstruation for a few months now and I'm worried that something might be wrong.
output: Based on your symptoms, we will need to perform a series of medical tests to determine the cause of your irregular menstruation. We will need to do a radiographic imaging procedure, hematologic tests, ultrasonography, pelvis exam, examination of breast, standard pregnancy test, and rectal examination.

input: Hi Doctor, I've been having some numbness and tingling in my fingers and arm. My arm also gets tired very easily. I've been told that I might have thoracic outlet syndrome.
input_KG: numbness, tingling, fingers, arm, tired, thoracic outlet syndrome
output: Okay, I would suggest we start with physical therapy exercises to try and alleviate some of your symptoms. We can also conduct other diagnostic procedures such as an interview, evaluation, and consultation. MRI will allow us to see if there is any nerve or blood vessel compression. Additionally, we can try other physical therapy and rehabilitation techniques. In rare cases, a thyroidectomy may be required, and cardiac stress tests can help rule out any potential cardiac causes for your symptoms.

input: Doctor, I have a lump on my wrist and it's been getting bigger. It's painful and limits my wrist movements, what could it be?
input_KG: Lump, Wrist, Painful, Wrist Movements
output: Based on your symptoms, it sounds like you may have a ganglion cyst. To confirm this, we need to conduct a radiographic imaging procedure such as a plain x-ray or MRI. We can also perform a complete physical skin exam to make sure it's not something else. If we confirm that it is a ganglion cyst, we may need to do an excision to remove it. After the procedure, wound care management and physical therapy exercises may also be needed to ensure proper healing and function of your wrist.

input: Doctor, I hurt my knee during a soccer match last week and I'm having trouble walking. I think I might have dislocated it.
input_KG: Numbness, Tingling, Fingers, Arm, Fatigue, Thoracic outlet syndrome
output: I'm sorry to hear that. Based on your symptoms, we'll need to perform a radiographic imaging procedure to confirm the dislocation. This could include a plain x-ray (X-ray), as well as an application of a splint (Splinting) to help stabilize the knee. Depending on the severity, we may also recommend physical therapy exercises (Exercises) to help with recovery. In some cases, we may need to do a Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) or other diagnostic procedures (interview; evaluation; consultation). However, we don't need to do an Electroencephalogram (EEG) (Eeg) in this case. Does that all make sense to you?

input: Doctor, I've been experiencing abdominal pain and diarrhea for the past few weeks. My stools are also bloody and I feel weak all the time. What could be the problem?
input_KG: Lump on wrist, Growing size, Pain, Limits wrist movements
output: Based on your symptoms, it's possible that you have Crohn's disease. I would recommend some tests to make a diagnosis. We need to start with some basic blood and urine tests, including a complete blood count and urinalysis. We'll also need to check your glucose levels, kidney function, and electrolytes panel. Additionally, we may need to consider intravenous fluid replacement to keep you hydrated.

input: Doctor, I had a surgery last month and now I am experiencing some infection in my wound area. Can you suggest what tests I need to take?
input_KG: Infection, Wound
output: You need to take a few tests. Firstly, you need wound care management which includes cleaning and dressing your wound. Then, a complete blood count (CBC) and hematologic tests to check your blood levels. Intravenous fluid replacement will be done to ensure that you remain hydrated. We will also perform a complete physical skin exam to examine the infected area. Additionally, we will check your glucose level and Electrolytes panel to monitor all the levels.

input: Doctor, I have been feeling really weak and fatigued lately, and I have also had some trouble with my digestion. Do you think there's something wrong with me?
input_KG: Abdominal pain, Diarrhea, Bloody stools, Weakness
output: Well, based on your symptoms, it's possible that you may have a folate deficiency. To confirm this, we will need to perform some medical tests. We will need to do a Hematologic test, a Complete blood count (CBC), an Electrolytes panel, measure your Glucose level, conduct a Urinalysis and carry out Kidney function tests. Additionally, an Electrocardiogram (ECG) will also be necessary.

input: Doctor, I've been experiencing swelling in my legs and feet for the past few weeks. It's been really uncomfortable, and I've been having trouble breathing at times. I think I might have fluid overload.
input_KG: An infection, Surgery, Wound area, Tests
output: I'm sorry to hear that. Based on your symptoms, we'll need to run some tests. The first one we'll do is a complete blood count (CBC) and some hematologic tests. We'll also need to perform a radiographic imaging procedure and an electrocardiogram. Additionally, we'll need to do a plain x-ray, measure your glucose levels, and perform some kidney function tests.

input: Doctor, I've been having palpitations and shortness of breath, and I was recently diagnosed with Atrial Flutter. What tests do I need to undergo to manage and monitor my condition?
input_KG: Fatigue, Digestion issue
output: Based on your condition, you will need to undergo several medical tests. Starting with an Electrocardiogram (ECG) to measure the electrical activity of your heart. Followed by Hematologic tests (Blood test) to check for any underlying blood-related conditions that may be causing or contributing to your Flutter. Radiographic imaging procedures like chest x-rays or a CT scan to check for any structural issues within your heart.Moreover, you'll require the following tests to monitor your physical health a Complete blood count (CBC), an electrolyte panel to track your body minerals levels, and a glucose measurement (Glucose level) for overall blood sugar levels. Finally, regular Kidney function tests (Kidney function test) will be needed as certain medications used to treat Atrial Flutter can cause kidney stress.

input: Doctor, I have noticed some changes in my skin. It's becoming dry and rough. There are some reddish spots and also a lump that has recently appeared. What could be the problem?
input_KG: Swelling, Legs, Feet, Difficulty breathing, Fluid overload
output: Based on your symptoms, I would recommend a complete physical skin exam performed (ML) to evaluate the overall condition of your skin. Additionally, taking a biopsy and excision (removal) of the lump for a lab examination would be necessary. We also need to perform other diagnostic procedures on skin and subcutaneous tissue to determine the underlying condition of your skin. Moreover, I will recommend a lipid panel to assess your cholesterol levels and wound care management for the new lump excision.

input: Doctor, I've got these small black spots floating in my vision. It's been worrying me a lot lately.
input_KG: Atrial Flutter, Palpitations, Shortness of breath, Tests, Management, Monitoring
output: It sounds like you may have floaters. In order to diagnose and evaluate your condition, we need to perform an ophthalmic examination and evaluation, which is a comprehensive eye exam. This will help us determine the cause of your floaters and whether or not any further diagnostic tests or treatments are necessary. Depending on your individual case, we may also need to perform other intraocular therapeutic procedures, as well as other therapeutic procedures on the eyelids, conjunctiva, or cornea. Additionally, we may need to perform a biopsy or provide ophthalmologic and otologic diagnosis and treatment as needed.

input: Doctor, I have been experiencing severe pain in my tooth. I think I may have a tooth disorder.
input_KG: Dry skin, Rough skin, Reddish spots, Lump, Changes in skin
output: Okay, we need to run some tests to confirm that. Based on your symptoms, we will need to perform other diagnostic radiology and related techniques to determine the cause of your tooth disorder. We may also need to prepare for treatment; facial fracture or dislocation, depending on the severity of your condition.

input: Doctor, I had a sudden chest pain last night and I feel shortness of breath. Do you think it could be a heart attack?
input_KG: Small black spots, Vision, Worrying
output: It's possible. We need to run some medical tests to determine the cause of your symptoms. We will start with an electrocardiogram to check your heart's electrical activity. Additionally, we will conduct hematologic tests, a complete blood count, and a radiographic imaging procedure such as a plain x-ray to check the health of your heart and lungs. Also, we need to do a cardiac enzymes measurement and kidney function tests to get a complete picture of your health.

input: Doctor, I have an open wound on my abdomen that won't seem to heal. What tests do I need?
input_KG: Open wound, Abdomen
output: Okay, for the wound on your abdomen, we need to do wound care management and a complete physical skin exam performed. We also need to perform an X-ray computed tomography scan to see how deep the wound is. Kidney function tests will also be required, as well as Prothrombin time assay to check your blood clotting. We will also need to perform intravenous fluid replacement to help you recover faster. Additionally, we may perform suturing of the wound if it's feasible.

input: Doctor, I fell down the stairs this morning and believe I may have fractured my leg.
input_KG: Fractured Leg
output: In that case, we need to perform a radiographic imaging procedure, or a plain X-ray, to confirm if there's a fracture. We'll also need to do a CBC to check your blood levels and see if you need any intravenous fluid replacement. Additionally, we'll need to run some kidney function tests, an ECG, and an electrolytes panel to ensure we're aware of any other issues.

input: Doctor, I am experiencing white patches in my mouth and it hurts when I eat or swallow. Can you tell me what medical tests I need to undergo for this?
input_KG: Open wound, Abdominal area, Tests, Heal
output: Based on your symptoms, you may have Oral thrush, which is a yeast infection. To determine the extent of the infection and identify the cause, a complete physical skin exam will be performed. We will also need to do other diagnostic procedures such as an interview, evaluation, and consultation. Additionally, an occupational therapy assessment, particularly speech therapy may help. A diagnostic bronchoscopy and biopsy of bronchus along with other non-OR therapeutic procedures on skin and breast may be necessary. Nonoperative urinary system measurements and other respiratory therapy may also be recommended to provide a complete assessment of your condition.

input: Doctor, I have a rash on my back that looks like small, scaly patches. It's been there for a few weeks and now it's spreading. What could it be?
input_KG: Leg fracture, Falling down the stairs
output: It's possible that you have Pityriasis rosea. To confirm the diagnosis, a complete physical skin exam will be performed. Microscopic examination (bacterial smear, culture, toxicology) will also be needed. Additionally, we need to examine your foot, maybe do a biopsy and have an ophthalmic examination and evaluation to make sure it's not affecting your eyes. We may also need to run an HIV screening.

input: Doctor, I think I might have an allergy to animals. My eyes get really itchy and I start sneezing every time I'm around them.
input_KG: White patches, Mouth pain, Eating or swallowing, Medical tests
output: Based on your symptoms, we need to perform some other diagnostic procedures on your skin and subcutaneous tissue to confirm your allergy to animals. We'll also need to run an influenzavirus antibody assay and a blood culture. However, we can rule out a CAT scan of your head and a corneal transplant, and we won't need to perform any procedures on your spleen. We'll also run some liver function tests to see if the allergy has had any impact on that area.

input: I have been feeling dizzy and lightheaded every time I stand up for the past few weeks. Sometimes I even feel like I might pass out. What's wrong with me?
input_KG: Rash, Small, Scaly patches, Spreading, Back<EOS>
output: It sounds like you may have orthostatic hypotension. To confirm this, I would recommend several medical tests including a complete blood count, hematologic tests, an electrolytes panel, and a glucose measurement. Additionally, an electrocardiogram and radiographic imaging procedure may be necessary to rule out any other underlying conditions. In the meantime, I would recommend intravenous fluid replacement to help alleviate your symptoms.

input: Doctor, I have been experiencing excessive snoring and feeling extremely tired during the day. What could be causing this?
input_KG: Allergy to animals, Itchy eyes, Sneezing
output: Based on your symptoms, it is possible that you have obstructive sleep apnea (OSA). To confirm this, we will need to conduct several medical tests including an interview, evaluation and consultation, electroencephalogram (EEG), echocardiography, ophthalmologic and otologic diagnosis and treatment, ultrasound and other therapeutic procedures on eyelids, conjunctiva, and cornea. In addition, we may refer you to a home health care service for further assistance.

input: Doctor, I have been feeling weak and tired lately. My muscles have been cramping too, especially in my legs. I would like to know what's wrong with me.
input_KG: Dizziness, Lightheadedness, Standing up, Fainting, Time, Past few weeks<EOS>
output: Based on your symptoms, it sounds like you might be suffering from hypokalemia. To confirm this, we would need to run a series of medical tests including hematologic tests, a complete blood count, kidney function tests, electrolytes panel, glucose measurement, and a radiographic imaging procedure. Intravenous fluid replacement may also be necessary if the condition is severe.

input: Hi doctor, I've been experiencing red, scaly patches on my skin for a while now. I believe it's psoriasis. What tests do I need to have done?
input_KG: Excessive snoring, Tiredness, Sleep disturbance
output: Based on your symptoms, you will need a complete physical skin exam performed, as well as a biopsy and excision of any suspicious skin lesions. Additionally, we will need to perform a lipid panel to check your cholesterol levels. Depending on the severity of the psoriasis, we may recommend other therapeutic procedures or other diagnostic procedures on your skin and subcutaneous tissue.

input: Doctor, I think I have dislocated my shoulder. It's really painful and I can't move it properly.
input_KG: Weakness, Fatigue, Cramping, Legs
output: I'm sorry to hear that. Based on your symptoms, we will be requiring a radiographic imaging procedure as well as a plain X-ray to confirm the diagnosis of a dislocated shoulder. We may also need to apply a splint to immobilize and support the affected area. For pain management, we may suggest intravenous fluid replacement. And as part of your treatment plan, physical therapy exercises will also be required. We may also need to do some cardiac monitoring to ensure no other complications arise. In some cases, an MRI may also be needed.

input: Doctor, I've been having some really bad abdominal pain and cramping lately, and I'm not sure what's going on.
input_KG: Red, Scaly patches, Skin, Psoriasis, Tests
output: It's possible that you may have intussusception, which is when one part of your intestine slides inside of another part. We'll need to perform some medical tests to determine if this is the case.Patient What kind of tests?

input: Doctor, I have been experiencing pelvic pain and abnormal vaginal discharge. I suspect that I may have cervicitis.
input_KG: Dislocated shoulder, Pain, Inability to move
output: Alright, to confirm if you do indeed have cervicitis, we will need to perform a few medical tests. We will start with a urinalysis, a standard pregnancy test, and a pelvis exam. Following that, we will also conduct hematologic tests, a complete blood count, glucose measurement, and check your kidney function with a kidney function test.

input: Good afternoon, Doctor. I've been experiencing severe sore throat, difficulty swallowing, and a fever for the past two days. Upon visiting a general practicioner, I was diagnosed with an abscess of the pharynx. What medical tests do I need to undergo?
input_KG: Abdominal pain, Cramping, Unknown cause
output: I'm sorry to hear that you have an abscess of the pharynx. Based on your symptoms, I would recommend that you undergo an Intravenous fluid replacement to keep you hydrated. In addition, we would need to perform X-ray computed tomography (Scan ct) to confirm the diagnosis and assess the extent of your abscess. We would also have to do Kidney function tests (Kidney function test) to determine your kidney function. Additionally, a Tracheoscopy and laryngoscopy with biopsy may be necessary. Finally, we would have to check for Influenzavirus using an antibody assay. We may have to conduct other diagnostic procedures that may include interviews, evaluations, or consultations. In some cases, if the abscess is large, removal through an excision may be necessary.

input: Doctor, I have been feeling very weak lately and noticed that my fingers and toes turn blue. Also, I have bruises all over my body that appear without any injury. Can you tell me what's wrong with me?
input_KG: Pelvic pain, Abnormal vaginal discharge, Cervicitis
output: Based on your symptoms, you may be suffering from primary thrombocythemia. To confirm this, we need to do a few medical tests. We will start with a complete blood count and hematology tests to measure the number and size of your platelets. We will also need to perform a complete physical skin exam and glucose measurement. In addition, we will do a hemoglobin A1C measurement and other diagnostic procedures to evaluate your overall health. If needed, we may also perform a biopsy to rule out any other conditions.

input: Doctor, I have been experiencing severe pain and stiffness in my hip joint. It's been going on for a while now and it's getting worse. What could be causing this?
input_KG: Severe sore throat, Difficulty swallowing, Fever, Abscess of pharynx, Medical tests
output: Based on what you are describing, it's possible that you have arthritis of the hip. To confirm this, we will need to schedule a radiographic imaging procedure, which includes a plain x-ray. This will help us see any changes in the joint that may be causing your symptoms. Depending on the results, we may recommend some physical therapy exercises or other therapeutic procedures like the insertion of a catheter or spinal stimulator and injection into the spinal canal. We may also need to do a magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) test as well as an insertion of a catheter into the urinary bladder to fully diagnose and treat your condition.

input: Doctor, I have been dealing with a decubitus ulcer for a few weeks now. It's really painful and it just doesn't seem to be healing.
input_KG: Weakness, Blue fingers and toes, Bruises, No apparent injury
output: I'm sorry to hear that. Based on the information you've given me, I recommend that we perform a complete physical skin exam on the affected area. We also need to do wound care management, as well as debride the wound to prevent infection. Additionally, we may need to consider excision or removal of the affected tissue. Depending on the severity, I may also refer you to a home health care service to provide additional care. Finally, we should do a thorough examination of your foot and consider traction, splints, and other wound care techniques.

input: Doctor, I have been feeling very thirsty lately and my mouth feels dry all the time. I also feel very weak and dizzy. Can you tell me what's wrong with me?
input_KG: Severe pain, Stiffness, Hip joint, Prolonged duration, Worsening
output: You might be suffering from Hypernatremia, which is caused by an excess amount of sodium in your body. To confirm, we need to run some medical tests such as Hematologic tests (Blood test), Complete blood count (Cbc), Glucose measurement (Glucose level), Kidney function tests (Kidney function test). We also need to check if you need Intravenous fluid replacement to restore the balance of fluids and electrolytes in your body. In severe cases, we might suggest a Radiographic imaging procedure like a Plain x-ray (X ray) to check for any underlying medical conditions.

input: Doctor, I am experiencing difficulty in hearing and it feels like I have lost my hearing abilities gradually over time.
input_KG: Difficulty in hearing, hearing loss
output: Based on your symptoms, you will require an ophthalmologic and otologic diagnosis and treatment. Additionally, a Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) will be required to identify any underlying cause of your hearing loss. Other diagnostic procedures such as an interview, evaluation, and consultation will also be done to determine the underlying cause of the hearing loss. Based on the diagnosis, other therapeutic ear procedures and diagnostic procedures on the nose, mouth, and pharynx may be required. Psychiatric evaluation and therapy may also be provided depending on your condition. Tracheoscopy and laryngoscopy with biopsy may be needed to diagnose underlying issues in the throat.

input: Doctor, I have a chronic ulcer on my foot that seems to be spreading. It's been there for weeks and it's starting to cause me a lot of pain.
input_KG: Thirst, Dry mouth, Weakness, Dizziness
output: Based on your symptoms, I would recommend a few medical tests. We need to start with wound care management to make sure we properly clean and dress the ulcer. Additionally, we will perform a complete physical skin exam to determine the extent of the damage. We may also need to do debridement of the wound if it is infected. Finally, we'll examine your foot and consider traction, splinting, or other types of wound care depending on the severity of the ulcer. In certain cases, we may need to do an excision or referral to a home health care service.

input: Doctor, I have been experiencing frequent bone fractures and weakness in my bones. I also feel a lot of pain in my back and hips.
input_KG: Hearing loss, Gradually losing hearing, Difficulty in hearing
output: Based on your symptoms, we will need to run some medical tests. First, we will need to conduct a Hematologic test (Blood test) to check your blood counts and screen for any underlying issues. We will also perform a Lipid panel to check your cholesterol levels. In addition, we need to conduct a complete physical skin exam performed (ML) to check for any signs of skin cancer. We should also conduct a bone density scan to check the strength of your bones. We also need to conduct an examination of your breasts and perform the Mammography (Mammogram) to check for breast cancer. Lastly, we will conduct a Pelvis exam to check for any abnormalities.

input: Doctor, I am experiencing abdominal pain, bloating, and constipation. I think I might have ileus. What should I do?
input_KG: Chronic ulcer, Foot, Spreading, Pain
output: Based on your symptoms, I recommend a radiographic imaging procedure and a plain x-ray to confirm the diagnosis. A complete blood count, kidney function test and a urinalysis will be helpful in determining the severity of the disease. Additionally, intravenous fluid replacement may be necessary to manage your symptoms.

input: Doctor, I think I have urethritis. I've been experiencing a burning sensation while peeing and there's a constant urge to go to the bathroom.
input_KG: Bone fractures, Weakness in bones, Pain in back, Hips
output: Okay, to properly diagnose urethritis, we will need to perform a few medical tests. We will start with a urinalysis, a chlamydia test, and a microscopic examination to check for bacterial smear, culture, and toxicology. In addition, we may need to do a blood culture and an HIV screen. If necessary, we'll perform an endoscopy and endoscopic biopsy of the urinary tract. We may also need to insert an indwelling catheter.

input: Hi doctor, I think I might be suffering from prostatitis. I have been experiencing pain during urination, pain in the lower back and hips, and frequent urges to urinate.
input_KG: Abdominal pain, Bloating, Constipation, Ileus
output: I see. To confirm the diagnosis, you need to undergo several medical tests. We will begin with a urinalysis, a hematologic test, and a prostate-specific antigen measurement. We will also need to perform a rectal examination and an ultrasound to check your prostate gland. Furthermore, we may require other diagnostic procedures such as interviews, evaluations, and consultations. In severe cases, we might have to insert a catheter into your urinary bladder.

input: Hi doctor, I think I have swimmer's ear. My ear is very itchy and painful.
input_KG: Urethritis, Burning sensation during urination, Constant urge to urinate
output: Alright, I recommend we conduct an interview and evaluation to assess the extent of the infection. We will also consult with an otolaryngologist for an ophthalmologic and otologic diagnosis and treatment. Additionally, we will culture the wound and perform an incision and drainage if necessary.
