input: Doctor, I have been experiencing a persistent cough, fever, and fatigue for the past few weeks. I also have chest pain and difficulty breathing. I'm worried that I might have histoplasmosis.
input_KG: Pleural effusion, Shortness of breath, Chest pain, Tests
output: I see. Based on your symptoms, we need to conduct some medical tests. First, we need to perform a plain x-ray to check for any abnormalities in your chest. We may also need to do an X-ray computed tomography (CT scan) for a more detailed evaluation. Additionally, an ophthalmologic and otologic diagnosis and treatment will be necessary to rule out any eye or ear infections that might be associated with histoplasmosis. Lastly, we need to do a lipid panel to check your cholesterol and triglyceride levels, and an examination of your breast as well.

input: Hi Doctor, I've been experiencing pain and discomfort in my back for quite some time now. I finally decided to come see you and I was wondering if you could diagnose what's wrong?
input_KG: Difficulty focusing, Eye fatigue, Vision problems
output: I'm sorry to hear that. From listening to your symptoms, it's possible that you may have scoliosis, a curving of the spine. In order to confirm this diagnosis, we will need to perform a radiographic imaging procedure, specifically a plain x-ray, in addition to other diagnostic procedures such as an interview, evaluation and consultation. Treatment could involve physical therapy exercises and other therapeutic procedures to manage pain, and depending on how severe your scoliosis is, we may need to use other physical therapy and rehabilitation techniques. As a further method of diagnosis, we may also discuss the possibility of an MRI.

input: Doctor, I have been having some trouble with my foot lately. I have a bump on the side of my big toe and it hurts when I walk.
input_KG: Vulvar disorder, Burning sensation, Itching, Vulvar region
output: It sounds like you may have a bunion. I would recommend a plain x-ray to confirm the diagnosis and to see how severe it is. We will also need to do a physical exam of your foot to determine if there are any other issues. Depending on the severity of the bunion, treatment options may include excision or removal of the bump, bunionectomy or repair of toe deformities, and wound care management. We may also need to use traction, splints, or other wound care methods to help with the healing process. Lastly, a complete physical skin exam will be performed to ensure there are no other skin issues in that area.

input: Doctor, I have been feeling some irregular heartbeats lately. I think I might have an arrhythmia.
input_KG: Weakness, Lack of energy, Vitamin deficiency
output: Alright, to confirm if you have an arrhythmia, we will need to run some medical tests. We will start with an electrocardiogram to check the electrical activity of your heart. We will also need to do some hematologic tests and a complete blood count to check for any potential underlying causes. A radiographic imaging procedure may also be done to take pictures of your chest and heart. Additionally, we will check your glucose level. Finally, we may consider giving you intravenous fluid replacement therapy to make sure your body is hydrated.

input: Hello doctor, I'm experiencing severe pain in my face. It's a sudden and intense pain that lasts for about two minutes and happens frequently throughout the day.
input_KG: Severe Pain, Face, Sudden Pain, Intense Pain
output: Based on your symptoms, it sounds like you may be suffering from Trigeminal neuralgia. This is a nerve disorder that causes sharp and sudden pain in the face. To confirm the diagnosis, we will need to conduct several tests, including an Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) to examine your brain for abnormalities. We may also need to conduct an Electroencephalogram (EEG), as well as ophthalmologic and otologic diagnosis and treatment, along with other diagnostic radiology and related techniques. In some cases, depending on the outcome of the tests, we may also need to perform other non-OR or closed therapeutic nervous system procedures to provide relief from the pain.

input: Doctor, I have been experiencing back pain and stiffness for quite some time now. It is quite severe and I have trouble getting out of bed in the morning. My joints also ache a lot. Can you tell me what could be the problem?
input_KG: Back Pain, Stiffness, Severe, Trouble Getting Out of Bed, Joint Aches
output: Based on your symptoms, it is likely that you have ankylosing spondylitis. To confirm the diagnosis, we will need to conduct a few medical tests. We will start with some physical therapy exercises to see if it helps relieve your symptoms. Also, we will perform a magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) to get a detailed view of your spine. Other tests may include the insertion of a catheter or spinal stimulator and injection into your spinal canal, as well as other non-OR therapeutic procedures on your musculoskeletal system. Additionally, we may do a bone density scan and other non-OR or closed therapeutic nervous system procedures if needed.

input: Hello doctor, I have been experiencing some weakness in my limbs and numbness in my fingers. Also, there is a considerable loss of coordination in my movement.
input_KG: Pain, Burning sensation, Urination, Increased frequency of urination
output: Ok, based on your symptoms, I would recommend a series of diagnostic procedures including an interview, evaluation, and consultation. We will also need to do an MRI scan and a Hemoglobin A1c test to confirm if there is any nerve disorder. Additionally, I would suggest doing physical therapy exercises to improve your coordination and examining your foot for any abnormalities. We will also have to conduct a lipid panel test and a depression screening to get a complete diagnosis.

input: Hello doctor, I have this bump on my skin that's been bothering me for a while now. It's painful and I noticed that it's been growing in size.
input_KG: Pain, Possible injury, Advice
output: Based on your description, it's possible that you have a sebaceous cyst. In order to confirm this, we need to perform a complete physical skin exam. Depending on the results of the exam, we may need to do further testing such as an excision, wound care management, or even a biopsy to determine the cause of the bump. In some cases, an incision and drainage may be necessary as well. Would you like to schedule an appointment so we can further evaluate your condition?

input: Doctor, I have been feeling very weak and dizzy lately. I think it has something to do with the antipsychotic medication I have been taking.
input_KG: * Cough
output: Oh no, that could be a sign of poisoning due to antipsychotics. We need to run some medical tests to determine the severity of the situation. We will need to perform a hematologic test, complete blood count, electrocardiogram, urinalysis, toxicology screen, and kidney function tests. Additionally, we will require intravenous fluid replacement to treat the poisoning.

input: Doctor, I have been feeling very anxious and stressed lately. I think I might be suffering from neurosis.
input_KG: Anxiety, Stress, Neurosis
output: Okay, to check for neurosis, we will need to run a few medical tests to determine the underlying factors causing your symptoms. We'll need to perform hematologic tests such as a blood test and a complete blood count (CBC) to check for any abnormalities in your blood. We'll also need to do a urinalysis, kidney function test, glucose measurement (glucose level), electrolytes panel, and a toxicology screen to rule out any other potential causes for your neurosis.

input: Doctor, I recently noticed some changes in my urinary habits and I am experiencing difficulty in passing urine with blood. I am worried I might have prostate cancer.
input_KG: Big toe bump, Foot pain, Walking
output: Based on your symptoms, we need to conduct a few medical tests to determine the underlying condition. We need to perform a prostatic specific antigen measurement, a rectal examination, ultrasonography, urinalysis, and a biopsy in order to diagnose if it is indeed prostate cancer. Additionally, we also need to conduct hematologic tests and other diagnostic procedures to assess your overall health and evaluate any other underlying issues.

input: Doctor, I have been experiencing headaches and nausea lately. I also feel like my vision has become blurry. I am worried that I might have cerebral edema.
input_KG: Irregular heartbeats, Arrhythmia, Heart condition
output: Based on your symptoms, I would recommend a radiographic imaging procedure such as a MRI or a CAT scan of your head. We would also need to check your kidney function through a kidney function test, as well as your glucose level. If we confirm your diagnosis of cerebral edema, we would need to give you intravenous fluid replacement.

input: Doctor, I think I have dislocated my finger.
input_KG: Face pain, Sudden pain, Intense pain, Frequent occurrence, Two minutes, Daytime
output: Alright, to confirm the dislocation, we need to perform a radiographic imaging procedure, which includes a plain x-ray. Based on the results, we may need to apply a splint or do an orthopedic casting to immobilize the joint. Additionally, if there is a wound, we may need to suture it. After the treatment, an occupational therapy assessment can help in the overall healing process.

input: Doctor, I think I am suffering from birth trauma. I have been experiencing a lot of pain in my arms and legs, and I feel like I am unable to move them properly.
input_KG: Back pain, Stiffness, Severity, Morning, Joint pain, Problem
output: It sounds like you may be experiencing some muscle weakness and stiffness as a result of your birth trauma. We will need to schedule some physical therapy exercises for you to help you regain strength and mobility. In addition, we will need to perform other diagnostic procedures, including a comprehensive physical skin exam and evaluation, as well as consultations with other specialists, to develop a complete treatment plan for you. You may also benefit from other physical therapy and rehabilitation, along with a referral to a home health care service. We will also need to assess your potential need for occupational therapy, speech therapy, and ophthalmologic and otologic diagnosis and treatment.

input: Doctor, I have this lump on my arm that is quite painful. It feels like a big bruise, but it has been there for a few days now. What do you think it could be?
input_KG: Weakness in limbs, Numbness in fingers, Loss of coordination
output: I think you might have a hematoma. We should do a few tests to confirm. We will need to perform wound care management to treat the area. Additionally, we will need to perform a complete physical skin exam performed (ML) to check for any other bumps or lumps. We will also need to do a scan ct or X-ray to confirm the presence of a hematoma. It is important to rule out any other potential serious problems, so we will also examine your breast and do an ultrasound. Finally, we will do a blood culture and prothrombin time assay to check for any underlying blood clotting disorders.

input: Doctor, I've been experiencing flushing, diarrhea, and abdominal pain. My friend told me it might be related to Carcinoid syndrome. What do you suggest I do?
input_KG: Skin bump, Painful, Growing in size
output: Based on your symptoms, we need to perform several medical tests. We would start with a radiographic imaging procedure and an X-ray computed tomography, along with an electrolytes panel and measurement of glucose level. We would also require a complete blood count and hematologic tests. Lastly, an echocardiography is essential to determine the extent of any valve disease associated with Carcinoid syndrome.

input: Doctor, I have these brownish growths on my skin that are becoming bigger and more frequent. They don't hurt, but they look unappealing. What could be wrong with me?
input_KG: Antipsychotic medication, Weakness, Dizziness
output: It's possible that you have seborrheic keratosis, which is a harmless skin condition commonly seen in older adults. To confirm the diagnosis, I recommend a complete physical skin exam performed by a dermatologist. Depending on the size and location of the growths, you may need an excision, excision of skin lesion, or biopsy. We may also need to do other diagnostic procedures on skin and subcutaneous tissue, or other therapeutic procedures, such as wound care management.

input: Hi doctor, I burned my hand pretty badly while cooking. What do I need to do?
input_KG: Anxiety, Stress, Neurosis
output: I'm sorry to hear that. Based on your symptoms, we need to perform some medical tests. We'll start with a plain x-ray of your hand to check the extent of the burn. We'll also need to begin wound care management and apply a splint to protect the area. Additionally, we may need to conduct a head CT scan to ensure you haven't sustained any head injuries. Finally, as a standard precaution, we'll also run a blood alcohol test.

input: Doctor, I had a spontaneous abortion last week and I am very worried about my health. Can you please suggest some medical tests that I can take to ensure everything is fine?
output: Yes, for spontaneous abortion, we need to conduct a series of tests to determine the cause. Hematologic tests, complete blood count, and radiographic imaging procedure can help in identifying any blood clotting disorders. A urinalysis can help detect any urinary tract infections that may have contributed to the abortion. A standard pregnancy test can confirm there are no remaining pregnancy tissues in your body. We may also need to perform a pelvis exam to check for any abnormalities. Additionally, intravenous fluid replacement may be done depending on your health condition.

input: Doctor, I think I have genital herpes. I am experiencing painful blisters around my genitals.
input_KG: Headaches, Nausea, Vision blurred, Possible cerebral edema
output: I am sorry to hear that. To confirm if it is genital herpes, we need to conduct several tests including urinalysis, a pelvis exam, a complete physical skin exam performed by Medical Laboratory, a standard pregnancy test, a chlamydia test, a lipid panel, and an examination of your breast.

input: Doctor, I have been feeling really stressed out and overwhelmed lately. I've been having trouble sleeping and I can't seem to shake this feeling of sadness. I think I might be dealing with some sort of adjustment reaction.
input_KG: Finger dislocation
output: Based on your symptoms, it's important that we evaluate your mental health. The required medical tests include psychotherapy and mental health counseling which will help to manage your symptoms. We will also do a depression screen to evaluate the severity of your depression. A toxicology screen and blood alcohol test is necessary to rule out any substance abuse. Additionally, psychological and psychiatric evaluation and therapy may be needed to help cope with your condition. We may also consider other physical therapy and rehabilitation to complement your treatment.

input: Doctor, I have been experiencing problems with my vision and my limbs feel weak at times. I also have trouble maintaining my balance while walking.
input_KG: Birth trauma, Pain in arms, Pain in legs, Inability to move
output: It sounds like you might be experiencing symptoms of multiple sclerosis. In order to diagnose your condition, we will need to perform a magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) test. Additionally, we may consider physical therapy exercises (exercises) and other diagnostic procedures such as an interview, evaluation, or consultation. Depending on the severity of your symptoms, we may also refer you to a home health care service, consider other therapeutic procedures, and perform an occupational therapy assessment or even debridement of any wound, infection or burn if necessary.

input: I have been experiencing difficulty swallowing and regurgitation of food for a while now. I am concerned it may be something serious.
input_KG: Difficulty swallowing, Regurgitation
output: Based on your symptoms, I would recommend that we perform an upper gastrointestinal endoscopy with biopsy to check for any abnormalities in your esophagus. Additionally, we will need to conduct a radiographic imaging procedure, including a plain x-ray, as well as complete liver function tests and glucose measurement. If necessary, we may also need to perform an electrocardiogram to evaluate your heart's function. Depending on the results, we may also consider esophageal dilatation.

input: Doctor, I fell down and hurt myself badly. I'm feeling a lot of pain in my lower back and pelvic area.
input_KG: Flushing, Diarrhea, Abdominal pain, Carcinoid syndrome, Medical advice
output: Based on your symptoms, it is possible that you have a fracture of the pelvis. To confirm this, we need to perform a radiographic imaging procedure such as a plain x-ray. We will also need to do some hematologic tests, including a complete blood count, and kidney function tests. Additionally, we will have to administer intravenous fluid replacement and an X-ray computed tomography scan (CT scan).

input: Doctor, I have been feeling short of breath lately, and I've been having chest pains. I used to work in a coal mine, and I'm worried that I might have pneumoconiosis.
input_KG: Skin growths, Discoloration, Unattractive appearance
output: Based on your symptoms and work history, it is important to run a radiographic imaging procedure, possibly a plain x-ray, to check for any abnormalities in your lungs. It may also be necessary to perform a biopsy to examine lung tissue for signs of pneumoconiosis. Additionally, nebulizer therapy may be necessary to help you breathe more easily. I do not think Influenzavirus antibody assay and Depression screen are appropriate for you. Lastly, it is important to run a Blood alcohol test to avoid any other potential causes.

input: Hi Doctor, I've been experiencing some chest pain and shortness of breath lately, and I'm worried about my high cholesterol levels. I think I might have hyperlipidemia.
input_KG: Hand burn, Cooking, Pain, Medical treatment
output: Based on your symptoms and concerns, I recommend getting a few medical tests done to confirm your diagnosis. We'll need to start with a Hematologic test, a Lipid panel, and a Glucose measurement to check your blood and sugar levels. Additionally, we'll do a Hemoglobin A1c measurement to analyze your average blood glucose levels over the past three months. We'll also need to perform a complete physical skin exam to look for any skin abnormalities and an Ultrasonography to check for any blockages in your arteries. Lastly, we'll perform a Prostate specific antigen measurement to rule out any prostate issues.

input: Doctor, I have been experiencing abdominal pain, diarrhea, and blood in my stool. I am also constantly tired and fatigued.
input_KG: Spontaneous abortion, Health concerns, Medical tests
output: Based on your symptoms, it's possible that you have ulcerative colitis. We will need to perform a series of medical tests to confirm your diagnosis. These include a blood test, CBC, sigmoidoscopy or colonoscopy, glucose measurement, IV fluid replacement, electrolyte panel, and a CT scan.

input: Doctor, recently I've been experiencing some discomfort and pain in my genital area. I think I might have an infection.
input_KG: Genital herpes, Painful blisters, Genitals
output: I'm sorry to hear that. We'll need to run a few tests to properly diagnose and treat your condition. We'll start with a urinalysis to check for any abnormalities. We'll also need to perform kidney function tests to see how well your kidneys are working. Additionally, we may need to do an incision and drainage procedure if there is a visible abscess. A blood culture will help us identify any bacteria in your bloodstream that could be causing the infection. We might also need to do a ct scan to see if there are any other underlying issues. Lastly, we'll want to make sure the wound is properly cared for. Are you okay with these tests and procedures?

input: Hi doctor, I have been experiencing some discomfort and pain during sex. I think I might have HPV.
input_KG: Adjusting to new environment, Stress, Sleep disturbance, Feeling of sadness, Adjustment reaction
output: I understand. To confirm if you have HPV, we will need to perform a few medical tests. First, we will need to conduct a pelvis exam, an examination of your breasts and other diagnostic procedures for your female organs. We will also need to conduct a Pap smear and a biopsy. Additionally, we will conduct a human papillomavirus DNA detection test and a standard pregnancy test.

input: Doctor, I've been having chest pains and shortness of breath, especially when I exert myself. I think I might have angina.
input_KG: Vision problems, Limbs weakness, Balance issues
output: Based on your symptoms, I would recommend an electrocardiogram, hematologic tests, radiographic imaging procedure, complete blood count, plain x-ray, cardiac enzymes measurement, and kidney function tests.

input: Doctor, I fell down the stairs last night and hurt my back. I'm having trouble moving my legs and I can't feel anything below my waist.
input_KG: Difficulty swallowing, Regurgitation, Food, Serious health issue
output: I'm sorry to hear that. Based on your symptoms, I'll need to perform a radiographic imaging procedure to get a better look at your spine. We'll start with a plain X-ray, but we may also need to do a scan CT to get a more detailed image. In the meantime, we'll need to keep you hydrated with intravenous fluid replacement, and we'll start you on physical therapy exercises as soon as possible. Depending on the severity of your injury, we may also need to involve occupational therapy for speech therapy.

input: Doctor, I have been experiencing difficulty breathing through my nose and have been suffering from frequent sinus infections. My ENT doctor believes that I may have a nasal polyp. What medical tests do I need to get done?
input_KG: Lower back pain, Pelvic area, Fall, Pain, Injured area
output: Based on your symptoms and the suspected diagnosis, I would recommend that you get an X-ray computed tomography (CT) scan and also undergo diagnostic procedures on your nose, mouth, and pharynx. Additionally, we may need to perform other diagnostic procedures such as interviews, evaluations, and consultations to confirm the diagnosis. Depending on the severity of the nasal polyp, we may need to perform excision (removal) of the polyp or perform other non-OR or OR therapeutic procedures on your nose, mouth, and pharynx. We may also need to perform magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) to get a more detailed view of the affected area.

input: Doctor, I have been having severe itching and scratching on my skin lately. It has caused a lot of irritation and has become very uncomfortable. I have been diagnosed with Lichen simplex.
input_KG: Itching, Scratching, Skin, Irritation, Lichen simple
output: I'm sorry to hear that. In order to provide you with the best treatment, we will have to perform a few medical tests. These tests include a complete physical skin exam to evaluate the extent of the condition. We might also need to perform a pelvic exam to rule out any possible infection. Wound care management will also be necessary to prevent infections and promote healing. Besides this, we may need to conduct a biopsy or excision of a skin lesion to help determine the underlying cause of the condition. Other diagnostic procedures on the skin and subcutaneous tissue may be necessary as well.

input: Doctor, I have been experiencing a constant irritation in my eyes and I think I might have trichiasis.
input_KG: Chest pain, Shortness of breath, High cholesterol levels, Hyperlipidemia
output: Okay, in order to confirm the condition we will need to perform an ophthalmic examination and evaluation, which includes a detailed eye exam. Depending on the severity of the trichiasis, we may need to perform other therapeutic procedures on the eyelids, conjunctiva or cornea. We may also need to consider a nonoperative removal of a foreign body, or even a corneal transplant. However, the other tests you mentioned like procedures on the spleen or removal of an ectopic pregnancy are not related to this case.

input: Doctor, I have been experiencing some symptoms lately and I'm worried it might be something serious. I have been having persistent abdominal pain, changes in my bowel movements, and blood in my stool.
input_KG: Abdominal pain, Diarrhea, Blood in stool, Fatigue, Tiredness
output: It's possible that you might be experiencing symptoms of colorectal cancer. We will need to perform some medical tests to confirm the diagnosis. We'll start with a complete blood count and check your glucose and electrolyte levels.Patient Okay, and what other tests will I need?

input: Doctor, I've been noticing patches on my skin getting darker and lighter in color. I think I may have a skin pigmentation disorder. What should I do?
input_KG: Inguinal area pain, Infection
output: In order to properly diagnose and treat your condition, we will need to perform a complete physical skin exam, including biopsy and excision of any skin lesions. We may also need to perform other diagnostic procedures on your skin and subcutaneous tissue, as well as provide wound care management and other therapeutic procedures.

input: Doctor, I'm experiencing pain and swelling in my groin area, and the lymph nodes around it are also swollen. I'm also having some discharge and bleeding during bowel movements.
input_KG: Pain, Swelling, Groin, Swollen lymph nodes, Discharge, Bleeding
output: Based on your symptoms, there is a possibility that you have contracted Lymphogranuloma venereum. To confirm this, we need to conduct several medical tests, including arterial blood gases (ABGs), blood culture, liver function tests (Liver test), cardiac enzymes measurement (Cardiac enzymes test), x-ray computed tomography (Scan ct), kidney function tests (Kidney function test), and Intravenous fluid replacement. These tests will help us diagnose and treat your condition effectively.

input: I have been experiencing a milky discharge from my breasts without being pregnant or breastfeeding. What could be the problem?
input_KG: Milky discharge, Breasts, Pregnancy, Breastfeeding
output: That could be a case of galactorrhea of unknown cause. To diagnose the issue, we would need to perform a few medical tests. These include hematologic tests (blood test) to check your hormone levels, examination of your breasts, standard pregnancy test, pelvis exam, mammography (mammogram), and a complete physical skin exam. We will also perform a lipid panel test to check your cholesterol levels.

input: Hi, Doctor. I have been experiencing fatigue, shortness of breath, and abnormal heart rhythms. I also get easily tired and have pale skin. I suspect I might have G6PD enzyme deficiency. What medical tests do I need?
input_KG: Fatigue, Shortness of breath, Abnormal heart rhythms, Pale skin, G6PD enzyme deficiency
output: You may need to undergo a series of medical tests to confirm your suspicion, including hematologic tests, a complete blood count or CBC, and other diagnostic procedures. We may also have to perform an ultrasound, vascular catheterization, or therapeutic procedures on your eyelids, conjunctiva, or cornea. In addition, ophthalmologic and otologic diagnosis and treatment may be necessary to address the possible effects of G6PD enzyme deficiency.

input: Doctor, I have been experiencing pain and numbness in my arm and hand, and I believe it might be due to nerve impingement near my shoulder. What medical tests do I need to undergo?
input_KG: Stairs, Fall, Back pain,Leg movement,Lower body sensation
output: Based on your symptoms, I would recommend that you undergo a series of medical tests. We need to perform radiographic imaging procedure, plain X-ray, and Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) to evaluate the extent of nerve damage. We can also refer you to a physical therapist for some exercises as well as occupational therapy assessment for proper speech therapy. Other non-OR therapeutic procedures for musculoskeletal system will also be needed to treat your condition.

input: Doctor, I think I might have toxoplasmosis. I've been feeling really depressed lately and my eyesight seems to be getting worse.
input_KG: Nasal congestion, Sinus infection, Nose obstruction, Nasal polyp, Medical tests
output: Based on your symptoms, I would recommend a few medical tests for you. We should start with a depression screen to evaluate your emotional state. Additionally, we need to perform other diagnostic procedures like an interview and evaluation to assess how severe your depression is. You may also need mental health counseling. In terms of your eyes, we might need to perform other therapeutic procedures on your eyelids, conjunctiva, and cornea to address any issues with your vision. I would also recommend an ophthalmologic and otologic diagnosis and treatment to see if there are any underlying conditions we need to be aware of. Finally, to rule out any potential neurological factors, a magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) scan would be necessary. We would also need to perform a Pap smear to assess if there is any damage to your reproductive system.

input: Doctor, I have been experiencing a lump in my breast. I'm really worried about it.
input_KG: Lichen simplex, Skin itching, Scratching, Inflammation, Discomfort, Irritation
output: Don't worry. We need to conduct some medical tests to determine the cause of the lump. Based on your symptoms, we will have to perform an examination of your breast, a radiographic imaging procedure, and a mammogram. We may also have to conduct a biopsy, ultrasound, a complete physical skin exam, and a pelvis exam.

input: Hello Doctor, I have this open wound on my hand and it's been bleeding for a while now. What can I do about it?
input_KG: Irritation in eyes, Trichiasis
output: We need to perform suturing of the wound to close it and facilitate proper healing. Additionally, we need to take a plain x-ray to ensure there are no foreign bodies or fractures. We also need to perform wound care management and apply a splint, if necessary. Lastly, we will culture the wound to check for any infections and suture the skin and subcutaneous tissue, if needed.

input: Doctor, I think I might have missed abortion, My last ultrasound showed no fetal heartbeat.
input_KG: Abdominal pain, Bowel movements, Blood in stool, Persistent symptoms
output: We need to do a radiographic imaging procedure like ultrasound or MRI to confirm the missed abortion. We will also require to conduct a complete blood count (CBC), hematology tests, and urinalysis to check any infections. Additionally, we may also conduct a pelvic exam and measure glucose levels. Lastly, we shall also conduct a standard pregnancy test to confirm the missed abortion.

input: Doctor, I was diagnosed with diabetic ketoacidosis. What tests do I need to take?<EOS>
input_KG: Skin pigmentation disorder, Patches on skin, Darkening and lightening
output: You would need to take a series of medical tests to evaluate your condition. Your treatment would include intravenous fluid replacement, hematologic tests like complete blood count (CBC), glucose measurement to quantify the glucose levels in your blood, electrolytes panel to analyse sodium and potassium imbalances in your bloodstream, urinalysis to check for ketones or other signs of kidney damage, and kidney function tests to assess kidney health.

input: Doctor, I have been experiencing some discomfort and sores in my genital area. I think it might be Granuloma inguinale, can you help me with this?
input_KG: Groin pain, Swelling, Lymph nodes, Discharge, Bleeding, Bowel movements
output: Thank you for sharing your symptoms with me. Yes, it is important to determine if its Granuloma inguinale through medical tests. You need to go for a pelvis exam and a urinalysis. We may also need to check your CBC (Complete Blood Count) and conduct some hematologic tests (Blood Test). In addition, We need to perform a human papillomavirus DNA detection test and a Chlamydia test. We will also need to provide appropriate wound care, like traction; splints and other wound care, as required.

input: Doctor, I have been feeling feverish and weak for the past few days. I also have nosebleeds and my urine seems to be dark. I think I might have Hemorrhagic fever.
input_KG: Fever, Weakness, Nosebleeds, Dark urine, Hemorrhagic fever
output: I am sorry to hear that. Given your symptoms and history, I think it's important that we perform a few medical tests. We need to conduct a CT scan of the abdomen to check for any internal bleeding. We also need to ensure that your nosebleeds are under control, so I suggest a procedure to control epistaxis. Additionally, we may need to perform a bone marrow transplant to treat any damage to your blood cells.

input: Hi Doctor, I've been experiencing repetitive thoughts and irrational urges that I can't seem to control. It's causing me a lot of distress and is affecting my daily life.
input_KG: G6PD enzyme deficiency, Fatigue, Shortness of breath, Abnormal heart rhythms, Tiredness, Pale skin, Medical tests
output: Based on your symptoms, it sounds like you may be suffering from obsessive compulsive disorder, or OCD. I recommend starting with psychotherapy and mental health counseling to help manage your symptoms. We'll also want to conduct a depression screen to ensure that is not contributing to your condition. In addition, a psychological and psychiatric evaluation may be necessary and occupational therapy assessment may be useful. We may also want to conduct an EEG to further evaluate your condition.

input: Doctor, I hurt my ankle yesterday while playing football. It's swollen and painful. What should I do?
input_KG: Arm pain, Hand pain, Numbness, Nerve impingement, Shoulder pain, Medical tests
output: We need to do a radiographic imaging procedure to properly assess the injury. We will require a plain X-ray to see if there are any fractures or dislocations in the ankle. After that, depending on the severity of the injury, we may also need to apply a splint or do an orthopedic casting. You will need to undergo physical therapy exercises to help you recover faster. We may also require an MRI to get a better view of the injury.

input: Doctor, I have been feeling very weak and fatigued lately. I also have been experiencing confusion and headaches. Can you tell me what is wrong with me?
input_KG: Toxoplasma, Depression, Eyesight deterioration
output: Based on your symptoms, you may be experiencing hyponatremia. In order to confirm this diagnosis, we will need to run a series of medical tests. These tests will include hematologic tests, a complete blood count, radiographic imaging procedure, electrolytes panel, glucose measurement, and kidney function tests. Additionally, you may need intravenous fluid replacement.

input: Doctor, I have been experiencing trouble swallowing food and my chest feels tight.
input_KG: * Breast lump
output: You might have a stricture of the esophagus. We'll need to run some tests to confirm. We'll need to start with a complete blood count (CBC) and intravenous fluid replacement. Then, we'll have to perform an upper gastrointestinal endoscopy with biopsy, plain x-ray, and esophageal dilatation. Additionally, we'll need to do an electrocardiogram and biopsy.

input: Doctor, I fell off a ladder yesterday and hurt my ankle. It's really swollen and painful, and I can hardly put any weight on it.
input_KG: Open wound, Hand, Bleeding
output: Based on your symptoms, I recommend a radiographic imaging procedure to confirm if you have a fracture of the ankle. Depending on the severity of the fracture, you might require a plain X-ray, application of a splint or orthopedic casting. You might also need to undergo physical therapy exercises to help you regain strength and mobility in the affected area. Besides, it's essential to examine your foot to gauge the extent of the damage and provide proper wound care management.

input: Doctor, I have noticed a lump on my arm that has been growing and causing pain. I am really concerned about it.
input_KG: Abortion, Ultrasound, Fetal heartbeat
output: Based on your symptoms, it is possible that you have soft tissue sarcoma. To diagnose this, we would need to perform a complete physical skin exam as well as a biopsy. Depending on the results, further tests such as MRI or other diagnostic procedures may be required. Treatment may involve excision (removal) of the affected tissue and wound care management post-surgery. We may also need to perform an excision of the skin lesion.

input: Doctor, I've been experiencing some pain in my bones lately. I'm worried that I might have a bone disorder.
input_KG: Diabetic ketoacidosis, Tests
output: Based on your symptoms, I would recommend a series of medical tests to diagnose the cause of your pain. We'll start with a radiographic imaging procedure to get a better look at your bones. Additionally, we'll need to perform hematologic tests to check for any underlying conditions that might be contributing to your symptoms. Since some bone disorders are linked to hormonal imbalances, I will also need to conduct an examination of your breasts to rule out any other conditions. Finally, we will perform a complete physical skin exam to check for any visible signs of disease. We'll follow up with a lipid panel and a bone density scan as well as a pelvis exam to further diagnose your condition.

input: Doctor, I have been experiencing sudden seizures and my family thinks that it could be epilepsy. What tests do I need to take?
input_KG: Genital area, Sores, Discomfort, Granuloma inguinale, Medical diagnosis
output: For the diagnosis of epilepsy, I recommend a few tests. Hematologic tests (Blood test) and Complete blood count (Cbc) to rule out other medical conditions that could be causing your seizures. Next, we need to take a X-ray computed tomography (Scan ct), Magnetic resonance imaging (Mri) and CAT scan of head (Head ct) to check for any abnormalities in your brain. We also need to perform an Electroencephalogram (EEG) (Eeg) to detect any seizure activity in the brain. We may need to conduct further interviews, evaluations and consultations as part of other diagnostic procedures.

input: Hi doctor, I have been struggling with a personality disorder and I'm not sure what to do about it.
input_KG: Fever, Weakness, Nosebleeds, Dark urine, Hemorrhagic fever
output: I recommend that you undergo psychological and psychiatric evaluation and therapy, and also consider psychotherapy and mental health counseling to help you manage your symptoms.Patient Okay, that sounds good. Do I need to do any medical tests?

input: Doctor, I've been experiencing sharp pain and a rash on my skin. My friend told me it might be shingles.
input_KG: Repetitive thoughts, Irrational urges, Distress, Daily life
output: Based on your symptoms, it's possible that you might have shingles. I need to perform a complete physical skin exam to confirm my diagnosis. (Note ML stands for Medical License, which is a credential that allows doctors to practice medicine.)

input: Doctor, I have been experiencing sore throat and difficulty swallowing. I think I might have strep throat.
input_KG: Ankle injury, Swelling, Pain
output: Okay, we can do an Influenzavirus antibody assay to confirm if it is strep throat. Also, we may need to perform Tonsillectomy and/or adenoidectomy if the infection is severe and causing trouble with breathing or sleep apnea.

input: Doctor, I have been experiencing difficulty in controlling my movements lately. It seems like my balance is off and I have trouble walking straight.
input_KG: Weakness, Fatigue, Confusion, Headaches
output: Based on your symptoms, I would like to order a few medical tests to confirm the cause of your condition. We will need to perform hematologic tests to check your blood counts and chemistry. Additionally, we will need to conduct a magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) test to assess the structure of your brain. Along with these tests, we will also conduct an interview, evaluation, and consultation to gather necessary information to understand your case. Furthermore, we will perform occupational therapy and physical therapy assessments to observe your movement and speech patterns, and provide you with relevant exercises and therapies accordingly. Lastly, in some rare cases, we might require cancer chemotherapy to treat associated tumors or abnormal growths.

input: Doctor, I think I have Osteomyelitis. My foot has been hurting for weeks and now I can't even put any pressure on it.
input_KG: Osteomyelitis, Foot pain
output: I'm sorry to hear that. Based on your symptoms, we need to do a complete physical skin exam to check for any wounds or infection. We also need to measure your glucose levels because high blood sugar can contribute to this condition. We'll need to do some wound care management, potentially with traction, splints, and other methods. An examination of your foot is necessary, and we may need to debride any wounds or burns. In some cases, surgery to remove infected tissue may be required, so an excision procedure may need to be scheduled as well.

input: Doctor, I have been experiencing dry eyes and dry mouth lately. I also feel fatigue and joint pain. I did some research and I think I might have Sjogren syndrome.
input_KG: Ladder fall, Ankle injury, Swelling, Pain, Minimal mobility
output: Based on your symptoms, it is possible that you have Sjogren syndrome. We will need to run some tests to confirm that. We need to perform a complete physical skin exam, a mammogram, examine your feet, and perform other therapeutic procedures on your eyelids, conjunctiva, and cornea. Additionally, we will need to check if there is any need for hip replacement, either total or partial.

input: Doctor, I have been experiencing a lot of pain and stiffness in my shoulder, especially when I try to move it. I can't lift anything heavy or even put on my shirt easily. What could be wrong?
input_KG: Shoulder pain, Stiffness
output: Based on your symptoms, it sounds like you may have adhesive capsulitis of the shoulder. To confirm the diagnosis and determine the severity, we will need to conduct some medical tests. These tests include physical therapy exercises, plain x-ray, magnetic resonance imaging, and other non-OR therapeutic procedures on the musculoskeletal system. Additionally, we may need to conduct a bone density scan and other therapeutic procedures on the muscles and tendons to determine the best course of treatment for you.

input: Hi doctor, I have been having abdominal pain, fatigue, and jaundice. I think I might have viral hepatitis. What medical tests do I need to confirm this?
input_KG: Bone pain, Bone disorder
output: Based on your symptoms, I would recommend that you undergo a set of medical tests that include hematologic tests, complete blood count (CBC), complete physical skin exam performed (ML), lipid panel, ultrasonography (ultrasound), other diagnostic procedures (interview; evaluation; consultation), and mental health counseling to confirm the diagnosis of viral hepatitis.

input: Hi doctor, I have been experiencing difficulty swallowing and snoring while sleeping. I also have noticed enlarged tonsils at the back of my throat.
input_KG: Seizures, Epilepsy, Family belief, Tests
output: From your symptoms, it seems that you might be suffering from tonsillar hypertrophy. output: You will need to take Somatropin to stimulate growth and development. You will also need to take Sulfamethoxazole to prevent infections, Pimecrolimus Topical to treat skin conditions, and Hyoscyamine to manage stomach and intestinal problems. Additionally, you will need to take Ortho Cyclen as a contraceptive, Carbamazepine to control seizures, Ascorbic Acid to support your immune system, Nystatin Topical Product to treat yeast infections, Phenazopyridine to manage urinary tract symptoms, and Nifedipine to treat high blood pressure.

input: Doctor, I have been diagnosed with cryptorchidism. What medications do I need to take?
input_KG: Open wound, Jaw, Medical tests
output: You don't necessarily need medications for cryptorchidism. However, it is recommended to get vaccinated with Haemophilus B Conjugate Vaccine, Hepatitis B Vaccine, and Rotavirus Vaccine. For symptom relief, you can use Desoximetasone Topical cream.

input: I have been experiencing vaginal dryness and itching lately. It's making sex very uncomfortable.
input_KG: Fatigue, Weakness, Infections, White blood cell disease, Tests
output: It sounds like you may have atrophic vaginitis. I recommend taking either Estrogens, Conjugated (USP) (Premarin) or estradiol to help with the dryness. We may also consider Betamethasone-Clotrimazole topical cream to help with the itching.

input: Doctor, I think I fractured my hand during a recent game of basketball. My hand is swollen and I cannot move it properly. What medication do I need to take?
input_KG: Kaposi sarcoma
output: You need to take Carteolol and Disopyramide to treat your fracture. However, please note that Carteolol is a beta-blocker medication used to treat high blood pressure and Disopyramide is used to treat heart arrhythmias. I'm not sure why you would need these medications for a fracture of the hand. Are you sure you have the right information?

input: Doctor, I have a cellulitis or abscess in my mouth. What medications do I need?
input_KG: Spondylolisthesis, Back pain, Diagnosis
output: You'll need to take Clindamycin and Penicillin to treat the bacterial infection. We'll also give you Dexamethasone Topical Product to reduce inflammation, and Chlorhexidine Topical to reduce the bacteria in your mouth. Additionally, we'll give you an antibiotic cream, Retapamulin Topical to apply locally.

input: Hello doctor, I have been experiencing an eye alignment disorder where my eyes are not properly aligned. What medications do I need to take to treat it?
input_KG: conjunctivitis, Virus
output: Based on your symptoms, I recommend that you take a combination of Atropine, Phenylephrine, Cyclopentolate Ophthalmic, Tropicamide Ophthalmic, Dexamethasone-Tobramycin Ophthalmic, and Methazolamide to treat your eye alignment disorder. These medications will help to reduce the symptoms and improve your eye alignment. Additionally, you may need Fluorescein, Colloidal Oatmeal Topical, and Benzylpenicilloyl Polylysine for additional support. Do not take Orlistat and other medications without consulting me first.

input: Doctor, I had a lumbar puncture a couple of days ago and I'm experiencing intense headaches. It's making it really difficult for me to focus and work.
input_KG: Open wound, Nose, Medical tests
output: I'm sorry to hear that! Lumbar punctures can often result in these types of headaches. I am going to prescribe you a combination of medications to help alleviate the pain. You will take Hydromorphone, Prochlorperazine, and Midazolam to help with the pain and to help you relax. I will also prescribe Caffeine-Sodium Benzoate to help boost the effectiveness of the other medications. Lastly, I'm prescribing Zolmitriptan to alleviate the migraines and Dexamethasone-Tobramycin to alleviate any eye issues that you might be having.

input: Doctor, I have been experiencing vomiting, nausea, and abdominal pain. I recently found out that I have pyloric stenosis. What medications should I take for it?
input_KG: Panic attacks, Anxiety, Sudden
output: You need to take Nizatidine (Axid) to reduce the stomach acid production and Simethicone (Degas) to relieve gas and bloating. You may also need Lactulose to ease bowel movements and Silver Sulfadiazine Topical to treat any skin infections. However, please note that Niacin, Nystatin Topical Product, Mecamylamine, Grepafloxacin (Raxar), Malathion Topical, and Gemtuzumab (Mylotarg) are not used for pyloric stenosis.

input: Hi doctor, I have been experiencing some issues with my salivary gland. Can you help me with it?
input_KG: Hoarseness, Throat lump, Vocal cord polyp, Medication
output: Yes, absolutely. Based on your symptoms, I recommend prescribing you Meloxicam, Pramipexole (Mirapex), Dicyclomine, Saliva Substitutes, Mequinol-Tretinoin Topical, Bleomycin, Desflurane, Entacapone (Comtan), Biotin, Rocuronium, and Cefadroxil. These medications will help reduce inflammation, increase saliva production, alleviate pain, and treat the underlying cause of your disorder. Note It's not realistic for a doctor to prescribe so many medications at once for one disease. It's important to consult with a doctor for proper diagnosis and treatment. Additionally, this dialogue only allows for one back and forth which limits the doctor's ability to fully address the patient's concerns.

input: Hi doctor, I have been experiencing pain in my hips and back. Sometimes it's unbearable, and I am finding it difficult to walk or sit for long periods of time.
input_KG: Pain, Hips, Back, Difficulty walking, Difficulty sitting
output: Based on your symptoms, it seems like you might be suffering from osteochondrosis. I recommend you try taking Acebutolol as it can help relieve your symptoms by reducing the pressure on your bones and muscles. Additionally, Botulinum Toxin Type A (Botox) can be injected directly into the affected areas to reduce inflammation and pain.

input: Doctor, I have been experiencing some issues lately, and I think I might have a metabolic disorder. Can you please provide me with some medications that can help me with this?
input_KG: Cryptorchidism, Medications
output: Yes, based on your symptoms, I recommend starting you on a combination of Ursodiol (Urso), Exenatide (Byetta), Alglucosidase Alfa (Myozyme), Levocarnitine, Fenofibric Acid (Trilipix), Raltegravir (Isentress), and Potassium Citrate. These medications can help to manage the symptoms associated with metabolic disorder and improve your overall health.

input: Hi doctor, I think I may have vaginitis.
input_KG: Vaginal dryness, Itching, Sex, Discomfort
output: In that case, you will need to take a course of medication that includes Metronidazole, Fluconazole (Diflucan), Metronidazole Topical Product, Terconazole Topical, Miconazole Topical Product, Betamethasone-Clotrimazole Topical, Clindamycin Topical Product, Tinidazole, Nystatin-Triamcinolone Topical, Cefixime (Suprax), Pentosan Polysulphate Sodium (Elmiron), Boric Acid Topical.

input: Hi, doctor. I have been experiencing irregular heartbeats, dizziness, and fatigue lately. My primary care physician suggested that I might have sick sinus syndrome, and I need some medication for it.
input_KG: Hand fracture, Swelling, Movement, Medication
output: Yes, that seems like a valid diagnosis based on your symptoms. I would prescribe you the following medications Warfarin, Digoxin, Sotalol, and maybe Amiodarone to regulate your heart rate. You also need Torsemide, Bumetanide, and Dopamine to manage your fluid buildup. You can take Vitamin E to improve your heart health, and Ibandronate to strengthen your bones. Finally, I recommend Flecainide, Dofetilide, and Isosorbide Mononitrate to control your blood pressure and keep it stable.

input: Hi doctor, I have been having issues with my vision lately. My eye feels like there is a lot of pressure in it and my peripheral vision seems to be getting worse.
input_KG: Cellulitis, Abscess, Mouth, Medications
output: Based on your symptoms, it sounds like you may be experiencing glaucoma. I will be prescribing a medication to help manage it. You will need to use a combination of 'Latanoprost', 'Bimatoprost Ophthalmic', 'Brimonidine Ophthalmic', 'Timolol', 'Travoprost (Travatan)', 'Prednisolone Ophthalmic', 'Brimonidine-Timolol Ophthalmic', 'Dorzolamide Ophthalmic', 'Brinzolamide Ophthalmic', 'Tropicamide Ophthalmic', 'Apraclonidine Ophthalmic', or 'Acetazolamide (Diamox)' depending on what works best for you.

input: Doctor, I think I have an eating disorder. I have been experiencing extreme weight loss, and I can't seem to control my eating habits.
input_KG: Eye alignment disorder, Medications for treatment
output: Okay, I understand your concern. We will need to put you on some medications to treat your eating disorder. I recommend starting you on Fluoxetine (Prozac), Trazodone, Quetiapine (Seroquel), Lamotrigine (Lamictal), Topiramate (Topamax), Venlafaxine (Effexor), Aripiprazole (Abilify), Minocycline, Benzoyl Peroxide Topical, Tranylcypromine (Parnate), Phenelzine (Nardil), and Chlorpromazine (Thorazine). We will discuss your dosage and frequency at your next appointment.

input: Doctor, I had a transient ischemic attack a few weeks ago and I'm afraid it might happen again. What can I do?
input_KG: Transient Ischemic Attack
output: Don't worry, we have several medications that can help prevent another attack. I'm going to prescribe you Clopidogrel, Deferasirox, Bethanechol, Dipyridamole, Gadopentetate Dimeglumine, and Bivalirudin. Make sure to take them exactly as directed and follow up with me regularly to monitor your progress.

input: Doctor, I have been experiencing sharp pains in my lower back and a burning sensation while urinating. I think I might have pyelonephritis, what type of medication do I need?
input_KG: Vomiting, Nausea, Abdominal pain, Pyloric stenosis, Medications
output: The required medication for treating pyelonephritis includes antibiotics such as ciprofloxacin, levofloxacin (Levaquin), ceftriaxone, cefotaxime, or cefixime (Suprax) depending on the severity of the infection. Phenazopyridine (Azo) can also help relieve the burning sensation during urination. In case of any pain, you can use Dihydrocodeine (Didone) and anti-fungal clotrimazole.

input: Hi Doctor, I'm experiencing a lot of pain and limited range of motion in my shoulder.
input_KG: Pain, Limited Range of Motion, Shoulder
output: It sounds like you may have a rotator cuff injury. I recommend a combination of medications including Triamcinolone Topical Product, Bupivacaine, and Cortisone to help manage the pain and inflammation. We may also use Rocuronium, Sevoflurane, Mepivacaine, Desflurane or Nitrous Oxide as anesthesia during any medical procedures. Additionally, we can prescribe Diclofenac Topical Product to further alleviate your symptoms. However, please note, that Rapacuronium is banned due to the risk of severe side effects.

input: Doctor, I have been experiencing chronic pain for some time now. It's unbearable and I can barely get on with my day-to-day activities.
input_KG: Hip pain, Back pain, Inability to sit or walk
output: I think we should start you on some medications to manage the pain. I'm prescribing you Oxycodone, Methadone, Carisoprodol (Soma), Oxymorphone (Opana), Diclofenac Topical Product, Milnacipran (Savella), Cannabis (Schedule I Substance), Cevimeline (Evoxac), Sorbitol, and Choline. These should help alleviate your pain symptoms.

input: Doctor, I am pregnant and I have been experiencing a lot of problems lately. Can you suggest any medications that could help me?
input_KG: Metabolic disorder, Medications
output: Yes, I can prescribe you with a Multivitamin and Prenatal supplement to ensure that you receive all the necessary nutrients during your pregnancy. You may also need a Miconazole Topical Product if you experience any fungal infections. Additionally, if you are Rh-negative, you will require Rho(D) immune globulin (Rhogam) to prevent any blood incompatibility issues in your baby. Clomiphene (Clomid) can be prescribed if you have fertility problems. For high blood pressure issues, Methyldopa can be prescribed.
